If you're watching a high-def movie, the 4:3 aspect ratio is going to leave large black bars on your screen and the video will be much more compressed than it would be on the HDX and Nexus. Apple chose to maintain backward compatibility with prior devices rather than moving up.Sound: The HDX has Dolby Digital Surround Sound; the Nexus has Frauenhofer Surround Sound; the iPad Air has stereo sound. The iPad Air also makes the same mistake that Amazon made in its first-generation tablet: putting both speakers on the same side (in this case, at the bottom of the tablet). If you're watching a video, you'll have the tablet turned sideways and the sound will all come from the same side. The HDX, in contrast, has the speakers placed perfectly for video watching.Networking: The HDX and the iPad Air both have dual band, dual antenna (MIMO) Wi-Fi. The Nexus is dual band but not dual antenna. All things being equal, I would expect the Nexus to lag a bit behind the others in networking performance, particularly in areas where the connection is spotty.Size and Weight:HDX: 9.1" x 6.2" x 0.31" and 13.2 oz.Nexus: Not yet announcediPad Air: 9.4" x 6.6" x 0.29" and 16.8 oz.The HDX is definitely smaller and it's significantly lighter than is the iPad Air, although the iPad is a bit thinner. The size difference isn't too surprising when you consider that the iPad Air has a larger screen (with a lower resolution, though).Processor:HDX: 2.2 GHz quad-core Snapdragon 800 processor, 2GB memoryNexus: Not yet announcediPad Air: 64-bit dual-core A7, 1GB memoryThe A7 is only a dual-core processor but according to some tech sites that have run benchmarks, it definitely holds its own against the quad-core Snapdragon. These are all pretty powerful tablets.Cameras: Both the Nexus and the iPad Air have 1.2 MP front and 5MP rear cameras. The HDX has a front 720p camera and an 8MP rear camera. Realistically, I doubt that the extra resolution on the HDX will make that much of a difference but if you take a lot of pictures, the HDX may be your best choice.Battery Life: HDX = 12 hours (18 hours when reading); Nexus = TBD; iPad Air = 10 hours. Amazon wins this one, particularly if you will be spending a lot of time reading.Expansion: None of them have a microSD slot; they all assume that you'll be using their respective cloud systems.Parental Controls: All of them have the basic parental controls that allow you to limit your child's access to content, purchases, the web, and so on. Amazon goes farther, though, with the Kindle Free Time and Kindle Free Time Unlimited options, the latter of which is an inexpensive subscription to a curated library of content. If you are buying a first tablet for a child, though, I'd choose the Kindle Fire HD. At only $139, it is significantly cheaper and it has all of the parental controls and options that the HDX has.Enterprise: As soon as Amazon releases its software update, it will add VPN and network printing support. I believe all of the tablets have basic enterprise capabilities, including that support and various office apps. For real corporate productivity, though, I'd go with a laptop, not a tablet.Support: Amazon wins this category, hands down, with the new Mayday system. Apple comes in second, with Apple and Amazon usually taking top marks in any customer support survey. This is an area where Google does not shine.Price: The HDX and Nexus win this category. With the HDX at $379 and the Nexus at $399, both are priced significantly less than the iPad Air at $499. Neither Google nor Amazon makes much, if any, money on their tablets; they're counting on you to purchase content from their respective stores.I don't think there is a single clear winner, as each tablet has strengths and weaknesses. If you already have Amazon Prime, the HDX is a no-brainer, with the access to the Prime Instant Video and the Kindle Owners' Lending Library. If you're primarily buying a tablet to read with, Amazon wins there, as well, with the 18-hour battery life while reading and the best display for reading outdoors. If you want apps, Apple and Google both have far more choices. If you want to watch movies, I'd pick either the HDX or the Nexus, as Apple's aspect ratio and its lagging sound put it at the back of the pack. If price is a factor, then you should pick either the HDX or the Nexus.If you're heavily invested in the Apple ecosystem, i.e., you already own an iPhone or iPad and all of your content is on iTunes, the HDX really isn't the tablet for you. Similarly, if you love browsing Google Play for apps to play on your Samsung Galaxy phone, you're likely to be disappointed in the section available on Amazon (although, as I note above, most of the Google Play apps can be sideloaded onto the tablet). If you love your Google Now or Siri, neither of which will ever be available on Amazon, this isn't the tablet for you.The bottom line: This tablet is primarily intended as a viewport into Amazon content and Amazon services. If you have Amazon Prime and you have Amazon eBooks in your collection, this tablet is a no-brainer. The price is decent, particularly for what you get, and it's a light, high-quality, high-powered, tablet with a stunning display and superb sound. This really is one of the top tablets in its class.Note: As others have noted, the tablet will update its software when you first turn it on and connect to wifi. Unlike some others, I had no trouble with this operation, no glitches or crashes. It took several minutes but the process ran smoothly, as did the tablet when everything was done.For a couple of reasons, I have all three of Amazon's 2013 tablets. So which one should you get?Kindle Fire HD - A good choice for a child or for a first tablet when you're not sure just how much you'll use a tablet. The price can't be beat and while it's clearly a budget tablet, it's not cheaply made. The only corner they cut is that they don't include a camera, so no Skype or self-portraits.Kindle Fire HDX - A good choice if you want the smallest lightest tablet of the bunch. If you'll be regularly on the go with your tablet and you want something you can easily slip into a purse or coat pocket, this is the tablet for you. You should also get this tablet over the Kindle Fire HD if you need a front-facing camera or you need the extra power. And you should get this over the larger version if price is an issue, since it's $150 cheaper.Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" - This is the one I use most around the house because I really like the large size and I love that I get that size with that amazingly low weight. If you need a rear camera, this is the tablet to get. And the one to get if price isn't an issue. I stick by my recommendation above, though, that you should probably wait for a sale or for Amazon to drop the price.This year, Amazon released three good, solid, highly competitive tablets. Personally, I think they got it right and I can recommend all three.Note: I check back here pretty regularly. If you have questions, I'll be happy to try to answer them.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful tablet!
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: I received my HDX 8.9" on the day it was released and have been enjoying it since then. Here are some of my impressions that may help you decide whether or not to buy one for yourself.1. Very nice to hold. This tablet is amazingly lightweight and thin. The HDX weight is about 1/3 less than the iPad Air! It is quite thin, and in a very good way. The back is nicely rubberized for a good grip, unlike some cell phones that are too thin and slippery, so much so that they feel fragile and are difficult to manipulate without a good case. The HDX is very, very comfortable to hold and manage.2. AMAZING screen. The screen on the HDX is the best I've ever seen. "Beyond HD" is not an empty marketing phrase. This thing surprised me with its color, clarity, and brightness. It still reflects noticeably, though.3. Easy to navigate. I can quickly and easily switch among reading, watching videos, shopping, and more. I happen to like the carousel system, because it lets me return effortlessly to any of the last few things I looked at. With the instant response of the touchscreen of the HDX, I can find books faster than on my Paperwhite.4. App selection. Most of the apps I want are available for my HDX. Dropbox and almost anything Google, including YouTube, are what I miss the most. But YouTube works just fine on the Silk Browser. And there are plenty of news apps, games, alarm clocks, The most annoying aspect of apps for Fire is the prevalence of 3rd-party apps that do a poor imitation of the original. There are scads of apps that try to connect you with Google, YouTube, etc. but do so poorly.5. Seamlessly integrated with all things Amazon. I buy the vast majority of books and movies from Amazon, and my HDX provides an unbeatable way to enjoy them. I have come to prefer watching movies and reading books on my HDX over and above anything else I have, including a nice large HD television with sound bar and fancy ultrabook with >HD resolution. Plus, I can shop from my favorite retailer. The HDX makes it easy and enjoyable to watch movies and TV shows, read books, shop, listen to music, go through my email, catch up on the news, and more. Our family has owned the 1st and 3rd generation iPads and numerous smartphones including the latest iPhones. When you consider CONTENT, other tablets cannot match the ease and seamless integration of the HDX.6. Mayday. I've only used it once, but I was pleasantly surprised. I honestly was not expecting Mayday to live up to the hype Amazon is putting out there, but my experience was just like the commercials! Hardly any wait and a prompt answer to my question.  Amazing!You may have recognized in the past that great hardware is nothing without great software. Well, in 2013, you might say that great hardware and software are nothing without great content. And now you can get all 3 from Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: The good the bad and the ugly - Missing items like "Officesuite"
Reviews.Author: Artist formerly known as Amazon Customer "ghe...
Reviews.Content: First of all I am exactly the audience that Amazon aims at with the Kindle.  I am complexity immersed in the Amazon universe as a Prime member for the last 7-8 years (and customer long before that) all of my music is on the cloud player and a huge consumer of Kindle books and prime videos. Amazon makes it easy by offering more than competitive pricing including freebies and really low cost books, music and apps. You don't get that with iTunes and the App store.  I used to buy a lot from the Apple store but since I discovered how much more I always had to pay for everything I switched and haven't been back.This is my sixth Kindle starting with a Kindle 2, Kindle 3, original Kindle Fire, Kindle Fire HD 7 and 8.9. So the day the HDX's were announced I ordered the 8.9.  I am a gadget freak so in addition to the multiple computers I own, I also own a New Nexus 7, and an Asus Vivotab Smart. I have also played a bunch with various iPads.The good:I can honestly and truly say this is the fastest, smoothest most appealing tablet by far (in terms of hardware)that I have ever held in my had.  The screen is simply stunning, my Google Nexus 7 has a gorgeous screen and is the same resolution as the 7" HDX.  but in spite of the similar dpi (326 vs 339) the screen on the HDX in my opinion is more vibrant, the colors just pop and at times it looks almost 3D.  One thing I haven't seen in any of the reviews is all that much about the sound. It is truly AMAZING sound for a tablet and frankly is better than my HP Envy with Beats Audio.  I watched Galaxy Quest on Thursday night.  It is one of my favorite movies is almost mesmerizing on this tablet.  I keep hearing about "virtual surround" on devices with two speakers.  I have never really experienced it.  But watching this movie I could hear Foley sound behind me!  Music is sharp and clear and not at all tinny like an iPad.  Web browsing is incredible, it is fast and smooth and easy to use. The enhancements to the interface and browser functionality work really well. I can honestly say this is the first tablet I have seen that I can really use as more than a casual browser.  I much prefer a PC most of the time but I am confident I can use this on the road.  With a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse I have full function.  Screen sensitivity is excellent and the on board keyboard is terrific but for these older hands separate devices are needed for real work.  (which makes my "ugly" part even more frustrating.Mayday is as good as advertised.The Bad:I have found several apps that don't seem to work on this including Madden 2014 Football.  I am sure they will be fixed in a matter of days but it is an irritation because I want to play!Speaking of play, it is really irritating that Amazon and Google continue to have an impasse on allowing downloads from the Google Play store. It may be true that Android is so customized that many apps won't work properly.  But many do if you know how to side load which isn't true for most users.  But what it does do is give people a lot of ammunition to the "The Kindle is just a machine for Amazon sales" argument.  Virtually every review I see says the Kindle family is only useful for people that are married to Amazon already.  Virtually every time I am in a retail store like Best Buy that has Kindles and other tablets I hear the store personnel steering away from Kindle for that reason. It is a very short sided policy on the part of Amazon.  Yes you bind your already loyal customers more closely to you but a more open policy would sell far more tablets and bring in many more new customers. The relatively small amount of sales lost to Google Play would be way overcompensated by the number of new customers Amazon would gain.  And it would take away the biggest criticism of Kindle.  I know that Amazon is providing a lot of encouragement to developers to provide apps for the Kindle store. One of those developers should be Google!Make sure if you plan on using the new Amazon Prime movie download service that you get at least the 32 Gig. HDX and preferably the 64.  The average 2 hour movie in 1080p is almost 10 gig of space, which is roughly twice what it would be on a PC.The Ugly:Missing promised items like OfficeSuite? One of the reasons I was really excited was that an office suite was supposed to be available on this and available for the previous Kindle Fire devices I already own at a fee.  There are a number of "Office" apps in the store, most of which are mediocre at best.An "office suite"  includes at a minimum a word processor, some kind of spreadsheet and a presentation editor.  When I gave up searching and contacted Mayday I was told that no I wouldn't find an app but if I had a document on the device I could open it.  She couldn't tell me what file formats it would open, like if it would open spreadsheets or presentations.That is not considered an office suite, that is a document viewer.  I do not see any way to create documents or even edit existing documents. At this point all major tablet vendors bundle at least basic Office capability. MS Surface and other Windows tablets offer MS Office 2013,  Apple offers iWorks suite which appears to be really nice.  I am using QuickOffice on my Nexus 7 which is of course written by Google and free for Nexus devices and a part of Android 4.4 KitKat.  Not providing an office suite when everybody else is and then trying to promote your device as being work and business friendly is not a good thing.  Saying you have an office suite when all you have is a viewer is false advertising and frankly shakes my loyalty to Amazon badly.Update:Actually when I copy something over from my PC and open it there is an "OfficeSuite" that shows up long enough to view the item and now yes it does open docx, xlsx and pptx files in addition to pdf. And it does allow for at least some rudimentary editing.  From the icon and capabilities it appears to be OfficeSuite Viewer from Mobile Systems Inc. The same app is available for free on Google Play and the Amazon store for free.But there is NO ability to create new documents and the application does not appear as available anywhere on the Kindle.  The average user isn't going to know how to find the viewer the way you and I just did.  There is an OfficeSuite Pro that I was not prompted to download that costs $4.99.What is included does not in any way constitute an "included Officesuite" any way you would care to define it.I am not an average user.  I support enterprise middleware and MS SQL systems for a major corporation and have been a systems professional for over 20 years.  If I have troubles what  kinds of problems will the average user have?

Reviews.Title: Mirroring is great! Mayday is unbelievable!
Reviews.Author: kdsm
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 for my wife. She already had a Kindle Fire 8.9 HD and was in love with it. She uses the oldone for reading books (works great),e-mail,and her jigsaw puzzles which she is fascinated with. She thought it couldn't get anybetter. I am a retired electronics guy and was blown away by the specifications of the new HDX with its fast quad core processorand its graphics coprocessor. I was particularly drawn to the MIRACAST capability that was mentioned. This is a wireless way tosend the screen content of the Kindle to a HDMI equipped T.V.There isn't much written about the MIRACAST feature, but I found out that NETGEAR makes a streaming video device called thePush2TV (PTV3000) which I also bought from Amazon at the same time. It arrived before the Kindle Fire HDX.I was so proud of myself for finding and downloading the "firmware" update for the Push2TV and I was ready for the Kindle to arrive. When the KIndle arrived it was cold from the outside and I decided to let it warm  to room temperature and wait for wifeyto come home from work.Wifey arrives and we began the process of trying to connect to the Push2TV device. I followed the directions to the letter that was a BIG mistake! I tapped the MAYDAY button (unbelievable genius that) and was connected to a very pleasant young ladywho knew less about "mirroring" than I did but she REALLY tried. Unfortunately that connection was cut off. I tapped the MAYDAYbutton again and was again connected to a pleasant lady who couldn't help me and was again disconnected. I think the disconnections were due to the fact that the MAYDAY operators took control of my Kindle and accidentally disconnected the WiFilink. I was getting frustrated at this point and I was also very disappointed, The mirroring was a big reason for my HDX purchase.I tapped the MAYDAY button for the third time (wifey says I'm stubborn, I prefer tenacious) and again spoke to a very pleasantyoung lady who could not have been any nicer. She and I could not resolve the problem either but she set me up to receive a call from an Amazon help operator. The call arrived within seconds and again I'm speaking to a really nice young lady (do you see a pattern here?). This lady's name was Charlie and she couldn't help me either but promised to research the problem andconnect me with an I.T. deity which I requested for after Thanksgiving because it was already after 10:00 p.m. my time.Here comes all the good stuff. Even though it was late, I was determined to make this thing work I'm retired and can work all night if I want to. I started at the beginning! This time I DIDN'T follow directions about pushing the button on the side of the Push2TV box! I did push the reset button with a paper clip on the Push2TV unit. I observed my T.V. screen and noticed that the versionnumber on my Push2TV was 2.4.3 this is really important! I did NOT need to upload new firmware. The firmware in my unit as shipped was NEWER than on the NETGEAR website which was 2.4.26! In the end all you have to do is connect the Push2TV toyour T.V. the turn on mirroring in the Kindle and your done.Mirroring is beyond belief. The picture on the T.V. is stunning. Amazon's MAYDAY might kill Apple's IPad.

Reviews.Title: Admitted Technophile Reviews The HDX........Why You'll Love It.
Reviews.Author: NicoleReviewsItAll "I Heart Books"
Reviews.Content: Revised **1/4/2014**(see below)First off in efforts of full disclosure, I own the previous generation of the Kindle Fire HD 7" and I orginially purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 7" as well. I returned that one, because the bezel around the screen, invaded the screen to much to make the device prove useful when reading magazines, and for viewing some webpages.Also, I have owned pretty much every tablet made including, the ipad 1 & 2, Samsung Galaxy Tab (orginial), Kindle Fire HD 7", Kindle Paperwhite, Microsoft Surface Pro, and most recently the Dell Venue Pro 8.I feel qualified to speak to the usability of this tablet in comparison to the others and in its own right. What I will not do in my review is review the technical aspects of the HDX, as you can read them on the product page.1. First Impressions:This device is solidly built, and it light as a feather. It is really a shame to put a case on this device as anything that makes this baby heavier is a shame. For the women out there that may be wondering, if you threw this in your handbag, your arm would not fall off, provided you have it stowed in a sleeve case or very light weight case. The speakers are placed at the top of the device and have a good output of sound at low and high volume. If you are using the device flat on a table it can muffle the sounds a bit.2. Screen:The screen is perfect. No blue haze, or abnoramalities whatsoever. The brightness of the screen is wonderful, and while I have not used the device outside, I have used it sitting near a window with the sun streaming in and I had no problems seeing the screen.3. Ecosystem (OS)It should not be a surprise to anyone that this device points to Amazon's ecosystem. People that knock this tablet for this seem to be off base. If you want a google tablet with no restictions, then buy a Nexus or some other type of tablet. Amazon is not going to build a table that points to another company ecosystem, anymore than Apple would allow you to interact with Google directly. Lowering the rating of the HDX for this reason is unwarranted.Using the Kindle OS is simple, and the onscreen hints help for first time users. If you are coming from a previous generation Kindle you should be able to navigate without much trouble with a few small differences. I also use Amazon's Cloud service for photos and docs, and you probably should also. Installing the Cloud Photo app on your cell phone will allow any picture you take to upload to the cloud and once you register your HDX, they will automatically populate. Such an awesome and thoughtful feature. The Cloud Doc feature works the same, install on your PC or Mac and any document you drag into the doc folder will automatically show up on your HDX4. Music Player:To my surprise, the HDX will show the lyrics to certain songs that have the Xray enabled. This is an awesome feature if you are someone that likes to know the words to songs, or if you are like me, a singer, and need to actually KNOW the lyrics to some songs. If you also have songs in Amazon's Cloud Music Player these will automatically populate on your Kindle when you register is, and if the lyrics are available they automatically show. You can also place your music directly on your Kindle via usb as well from your PC or MAC if you want.5. Kindle Book ReaderI read entire book on my HDX just to make sure that I did not have eye strain or any other issues before deciding to rate this tablet. Amazon for me has always been about books first and of course my HDX excels here as well. I read well into the night and all the next day with no eye fatigue, or issues.6. Video/Prime SubscriptionOk, people here are getting upset about the prime subscription. For the $79 bucks a year you get free 2 day shipping on most anything in the Amazon market place and a thousands of free movies, of which some are downloadable, 1 free book you can borrow each month, and now a free book that is new to the Kindle store to preview. That's a lot of stuff to consider, and yes there are improvements to be made, such as choosing a movie from the Prime Movies to Download category showed movies that I could not download along side the downloadable ones (so why the category?) but overall, its not a deal breaker. You have a month to decide either way.The videos are beautiful, with wonderful color and sound. Not much to say here. This was another expected point.7. ProductivityI wanted to see if the tablet could really function as quasi laptop for when I was out of the office and still needed to stay in touch with work. I added my Microsoft Exchange Account (along with my personal email accounts) and was surprised to see that my work email was able to sync easily along with my Exchange Calendar. All my contacts were added to the HDX as well. The true test came when I needed to open a spreadsheet emailed to me, which I was able to do. The HDX comes with a program that allows you to view office documents, to edit requires you to purchase the full version. I own my own business, so being out of the loop is never really an option, and I am always looking for devices to allow me some acces to work without carrying 3 or 4 different devices.8. PrintingI was able to print to my HP Laserjet printer, the HDX required me to download a HP Printer App, which allowed me to print an email just fine. You are supposed to be able to print emails and docs. I would like to be able to print from the Silk Browser as well, but I'm not sure that this device allows that. Maybe I'm wrong. Somebody please correct me if I am.9. Mayday Button:This may seem gimmicky, until you actually need help, which I did. I purchased another HDX for my husband, and while setting up his, all the books and music and newsstand items synced, but not the apps. Odd to say the least! I pushed the Mayday Button and within seconds I was connected to a nice lady who tried to help me, but was unable to fix my problem. She transfered me to another woman, who I could not see as she was with Kindle Second Level Support, but who I was able to speak to online. She needed to call me back becuause I had to reset the HDX, which she did right away, and helped me solve my issue. Which by the way was to deregister and then re-register the device and everything was able to sync perfectly.10. Magazine Reading:As I stated earlier reading a magazine on the 7" HDX is just too small to see the pictures and text completely. The 8.9" solves that problem, opening up a whole new world for me. I subscribe to several boating magazines, where there are a lot of pictures of beautiful boats that I want to see. Also, utilizing the 'reading view' allows you to pull the article you are reading into one cohesive reading screen. Great!11. BrowsingSilk is fast and easy to use. Not sure why people do not like it. Not much to say here.12. BluetoothI was able to pair the HDX to a Bose Speaker easily and an external keyboard within seconds. Again, not much to say here, bluetooth works as expected.In conclusion, I hoped I have answered any questions you may have from the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" I cannot really speak to gaming, as I do not use any gaming apps, but take it from somebody that loves trying out new tablet, this one is definately one I'd recommend to someone that loves to read, watch movies, read a few emails, and listen to their favorite music. This a consumption device, and all roads lead you to being able to read, watch, listen or browse easily and quickly.**Update 12/21/2013**I thought I'd update you on how my and my husband's experience has been with the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.My husband has an Ipad2 which he uses daily. I have noticed that he uses the Kindle Fire a lot more everyday. I asked him about his experience and he told me that the Kindle Fire is much lighter and the screen resolution is better. The only thing that stops him for using it fully, it that he has some apps he paid for on the Ipad that he does not want to pay for again. He is a bit of a technophobe, and he has also found that navigating the Kindle is pretty easy.We also purchased the device with special offers and he really likes it. He likes getting the special deals on the lock screen, and even the recommendations from the Carousel.He is a big Netflix, Slingbox, HBOGO user, and he finds that the Kindle Fire handles all of these apps well.My experience is really surprising for me, as I find myself using my Kindle Fire HDX for work a lot more. I can easily look up information on our company website when I am away from my office, and even respond to emails easily. I am having a bit a trouble transferring documents to my Kindle via usb for some reason. PDFs and word docs transfer easily, but for some reason excel files will not. Not sure why I keep getting an error. Beware though, it does take a few minutes for docs transferred via usb to show up on the Kindle for some reason.Working with the docs with the Office Suite App is pretty easy too!Revision 1/4/2014There seems to be some problem with my Fire HDX hanging a lot. I am getting a message saying that I do not have a wireless connection, when clearly I have full bars. I have made sure there is no issue with my WI-FI - none of my other devices are losing a signal. The only fix is to disconnect from the network and reconnect and then I can continue with what I was doing.I also have had an issue playing videos. Both on Prime, and on the A&E; App. At first I thought it was the app, so I closed it an reopened, still was unable to play videos. Next I tried to watch a Amazon video and was unable to even pull up the first screen that pops up when you press video. I had to turn my Fire on and off before I was able to play any videos. I do not that sometimes these devices need to be turned off and on to 'clear' or reset them, but with these two issues, I'm getting a little concerned. The WI-FI issue is starting to be a hourly occurance. I am going to have to press Mayday to find out what is going on. I will have to lower my review by one star. This whole device is dependent on the wireless connection. If that does not work well, then it's just a nice looking paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Let's take a look....
Reviews.Author: ND Mike "rabid1"
Reviews.Content: First things first. I have been one of the most outspoken people against Kindle tablets. The lack of hardware options and the proprietary interface always were a big minus to me. That is why writing this review is painful in soooo many ways.As a big supporter and developer for the lesser brand and generic tablets I have owned around 50 tablets in the last 3 years. I always look at hardware potential first, OS functionality second because that can be fixed. That is also why I decided to check out the Fire HDX 8.9. The hardware specs made it difficult to believe it can't deliver. It does indeed deliver.While benchmarks can often be misleading in real world application but they still give a good performance comparison and an idea of what to expect. In Quadrant it hits with a blazing 19,546 and in Antutu it jumps in at 31,765. To put this into perspective the Galaxy Note * get's about 18,000 in Antutu.The tablet is thin and light to the point of thinking I got an empty shell, but it still manages to feel solid. I have an Afunta 8 inch that while a little heavier still feels like it is going to break in your hands. As thin as the HDX is there is no flex to the case.When I booted the HDX the display is obviously the first thing I noticed. (OK the boot speed surprised me first) It is really crisp and bright and the colors are crisp. Even when set at the lowest brightness movies are still entirely watchable. The touchscreen itself is very responsive, a little sensitive so it took a a bit of getting used to. But having big fingers isn't the tablet fault.Both the N and A wifi are strong and solid. The 5GHZ connection is the best of the 3 tablets I have that use it. The 32GB HP Touchpad is the closest. I can hold -55dbm all the way out to the curb. With Netflix set to the highest quality it needs no refresh time when the movie starts.The speaker quality is easily the best I have experienced. Not just volume but actual sound quality.The rear camera with flash always sounds great. I have several tablets with this feature and up until I bought the Sero 7 Pro it has always been short of useless. The HDX exceeds the 7 Pro. The pictures taken with flash off the HDX look like they came off a camera, not a tablet with a camera on it.As for the things the HDX is missing. HDMI out, MicroSD, I can't knock off points for thing that you should know about before you buy. Lack of research on the part of the buyer isn't the manufacturers fault. Just like knocking a tablet for not having Google Play when it isn't a Google certified device.  You don't buy a chain saw to hammer nails do you?As for apps it is simple enough to side load apps onto the HDX.I really was planning on writing a scathing review thus justifying my dislike for proprietary tablets. But as a pure tablet the Kindle Fire HDX is amazing. There are tablets within the price point that may have more features, but none can do what the HDX does as well as the HDX. That goes for much more expensive tablets as well. Time will tell if there will be a lot of independent development on the HDX but I would guess the hardware will draw developers like candy draws a fat kid.

Reviews.Title: one more
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: I have been buying kindles since the 1st generation, so I will leave the very wordy reviews to others and simply tell you, this is the fastest smoothest kindle so far. I am surprised how much faster and  user friendly this HEX is, BUT IT KEEPS AUTO CORECTING HEX $$_#)(5#4#. Guess I will be turning that off. But this is the one to buy. Trust me I wouldn't lie to you.  HDX- THERE I TURNED AUTO CORECT OFF:)I have been using my 8.9hdx for a few weeks now and I must say I am more impressed than ever, I almost never use my i-pad ANYMORE, This HDX is a quantum leap from the HD.

Reviews.Title: Worth the upgrade from the KFHD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Martin Gregorski
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the KFHD 8.9 and the new HDX doesn't disappoint in any way.  It is better at everything than the "old" HD.The screen on this thing in STUNNING. It has the nicest screen of any electronic device that I own.  The colors are bright and crisp, movies are wonderful on it.I can actually browse the internet on the HDX.  Sure I could have used the KFHD, but the experience was't great.  The HDX makes it so easy, the pages load fast, Silk is pretty good (but I sideloaded Chrome-which I prefer), just an altogether better experience.My wife grabbed the HDX and couldn't believe how light it was.  It is very thin and light.MISC:  No blue haze on reading books like it's little brother has (7" HDX), I sideloaded an earlier Flash version from Adobe which works well, the iCade bluetooth controller works with the HDX.  Downloading movies in the best setting takes up A LOT of memory.  The back camera works well and comes with a bunch of edits that you can do to the pictures (create a MEME, as mustaches, etc)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TABLET
Reviews.Author: Kesharon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it!  If you are an Amazon Prime Member, this is a must have.  The display totally beats the iPad, especially since Apple came out with iOS7 which changed the display on my iPad2 and mini for the worse.  The sound on the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is awesome.  Streaming is quick, clear and little to no buffering.  The interface is easy to understand and initial screen tips make it very easy to operate out of the box.  Does it have tons of apps? No.  But does it have more than enough features to keep you entertained?  Absolutely!  Here are some of the features my family have used and like:streaming prime movies and shows for freeease of adding an audible option to an existing ebookability to follow along with text to speechadding book marks and notes to the audio versiongetting a digital copy of a book for $.99 after purchase of a physical copyblown away by the picture quality of graphic novelschanging the format of the web browser for better reading viewsThis is for anyone looking for a tablet and loves Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Wireless is too unstable
Reviews.Author: Joshua K. Ferrell "virtualgeek"
Reviews.Content: Let me first say I really wanted to be a Kindle Fire HDX fan. I recently ditched an iPad 4 in favor of the Kindle but found ultimately that the device just doesn't perform. Upon receiving the Kindle I connected to my lab network powered by an Ubiquiti Unifi AP-LR which provides 802.11n MIMO. I went about downloading my cloud stored apps and books but found some interesting symptoms.When downloading my Kindle would sometimes timeout after prolonged periods of waiting with no start of the download, other times with apps like Olive Tree's Bible Study I would download one of the Bibles and the download would stall and timeout at different points maybe after 1MB or even nearly complete. When surfing my page load times were unbearable. It wasn't just that my pages loaded slowly but my pages wouldn't start to load until several seconds after hitting a link or enter at best. Sometimes they would never load. I tried restarting the Kindle, resetting the Kindle, completely erasing the Kindle, de-registering and registering the Kindle again. I changed my wireless security, I changed from HT20 to HT40, I assigned static IPs vs. DHCP, I used public DNS versus my internal DNS server. I turned every single device off in the house, disabled Amazon's page surfing booster and still didn't see a performance improvement. I downloaded a Wifi Analyzer and watched the Kindle drop the signal strength every few seconds, I pinged internal servers and saw fairly typical responses but if I pinged an external server I saw between 10-15% packet losses. Other devices on the network did not experience the same performance and even other Android devices running the same analyzer never saw the same signal drop at all.I called Kindle customer service who asked me to do all I had already done and then went on to ask that I reset the router I use to power over 40 different devices including our virtual machines in a lab environment. When I explained to them why I couldn't they told me it was because I had too many "people" on my network that my Kindle didn't work as fast despite no other machines experiencing the same. I eventually conceded and reset the router, no difference. I open the Kindle IP up to the internet completely unprotected by the firewall and still got no different response. The last recommended step per Amazon was to drive to an Internet cafe and try their internet. Despite how ridiculous that sounded I did go to another location and get on their wireless connection with the same results. I exchanged the Kindle for another Kindle thinking I had a defective unit. The second Kindle did have marginally better performance but still the same symptoms so today I forfeited and got a RMA to go back to the iPad.As a device the interface is great, I didn't have an issue with reading a book or using an application if it worked but it seldom worked and since tablets are primarily internet connected devices it just isn't anything above one star without functioning wireless. Prior to boxing it up the Kindle started to not show a MAC address or valid wireless option and would take several restarts to get the wireless connection to appear again. I may have left out one of the resolutions I tried but I believe I went well beyond what a typical consumer would do anyway to troubleshoot a device.If Amazon's engineers need it, I finally ended up on channel 1 of HT40 for the best performance which is to say I was able to surf with still long delays or no page load at all unless I sent the request a second time. I think it's fairly common but the initial ping was often times 4 to 5x longer then the subsequent replies and the software my wireless APs run showed the Kindle as going in and out of powersave mode from second to second. I booted up Wireshark and did notice that when pinging an address from the time I started the command using Fing on the Kindle to the time it showed up on my network was near equivalent to the maximum ping response time minus the average ping response time. I have a feel that the power save features of the wireless chipset may give an additional hour or so of run time but create a performance issue and since it isn't user selectable it's a pain.Thanks again Amazon, better luck on the next release.

Reviews.Title: UPDATE: Kindle Fire HDX was NOT what I expected!!!
Reviews.Author: Bennett Jackson
Reviews.Content: I recently ordered the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" and I was very happy with the device, if only for the 4 hours that the Kindle actually worked properly. The Kindle reset on it's own once or twice within a span of twenty minutes, but it eventually loaded after a few minutes. Then the device reset itself after I tried to start up a new app for my e-mail, it took 20 minutes with the Kindle resetting over and over before it came back on. I contacted customer service and I was told that my problem would have to be forwarded to the Kindle developers and I probably wouldn't hear back for a few business days.So far my Kindle is still running through the power cycle, over and over, but if I don't get this issue resolved and receive a new Kindle within the next week I will be demanding a refund.I did enjoy the high-def quality of the screen and how it played videos. I just wish Amazon got rid of all the bugs before putting stock into this new device. I also happened to order the Origami case and I am very happy with this accessory.I really hope this was a fluke and I happened to receive the one Kindle in the whole bunch that didn't work. I'll update my review if I happen to receive a new Kindle.UPDATE:Earlier this week I received a brand new replacement Kindle. Fortunately it seems that the first Kindle Fire HDX that I received just happened to be a, one in a million, defective device. I wanted to wait a few days before I reviewed this item for the second time. I did this so I could see if my new Kindle had the same problems as the old one and I wanted to be able to play with and try to experiment with all the bells and whistles.Display: The display is crisp and clear, with no blue bleeding around the border. This was a problem that some people reported, but that isn't the case with mine.Ease of Use: The Kindle Fire HDX is very simple and easy to use. I have yet to use the Mayday button, but the mere fact that it is there makes all the difference.Apps: There are a lot of apps available for the Kindle and I have downloaded most of the same games and apps that I use on my phone. There are a few apps that are not availble for the Kindle, but they are few and far between.Video: I have used my Amazon Prime membership to watch several free movies and tv shows on the Kindle and I am very impressed with the resolution and playback.Books: I really enjoy using the Kindle to read books. I was dead set against using an e-reader, but my growing hardback and paperback collection and the slowly dwindling space in which to put my books, has made me rethink purchasing a Kindle. I like how the kindle allows me to place bookmarks, toggle text size and most importantly the price of each Kindle version of books I read.The only real issue I had with Amazon, was how long it took them to send me a replacement. All in all, I am thoroughly enjoying my new Kindle and I hope to enjoy it for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: My fourth Kindle is best yet
Reviews.Author: Jean L. Hohnstein "Mugwump"
Reviews.Content: Lovely device! First thing I noticed was the weight -- rather, the "lack of" weight. I hoisted the HDX in one hand and my "old" Kindle Fire HD in the other, and it was the proverbial night-and-day moment. The fact it's slightly smaller and thinner as well is great, but holding it for a long time, say reading in bed, the older one made my arthritic hands carp and grumble every time. This one does not.Although I had specified the "no-offers" option in my order (which is what I got, let me add) all of a sudden last night at around 10:30 PM I suddenly started getting "offers," much to my shock. However, that turned into an enjoyable experience: I got to test, firsthand, the new Mayday button. I spent perhaps five minutes chatting with a friendly girl named Deborah who, once she verified my claim, took over my Kindle and fixed my problem. This, admittedly, was not an earth-shaking concern, but I was very impressed with how easy it was to use this new service as well as its novelty. iPod, eat your heart out!Two small complaints, neither of which impel me to change my rating of the device from five to four stars: a few of the apps I BOUGHT for the Kindle Fire HD apparently will not work on the new one; and I miss the variety of "wallpaper" available on my earlier one, being left with this slightly odd copper and blue whatever-it-is that appears each time the Kindle opens. I would enjoy having the ability to change the wallpaper at will as I do other Android devices, such as my LG cell.Admittedly, I've used it for only a few days. But so far, I am greatly impressed with its quality in all respects. Stunning screen quality, excellent Dolby sound, very quick responses to moving from, say, email to one's current book . . . Like I said, I like this new Kindle, very much.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fan, Amazon Fan, but HDX experience not the best
Reviews.Author: lovelovelove
Reviews.Content: I have two 32GB Kindle Fire HD's, one of which I bought as refurbished for a lower price than retail.  Wanted the new HDX too - it was shiny and seemingly fabulous.  Advertising promises "faster" and better display, and "mayday.", etc.  HAD to have it!  Got it about 40 days ago - had issues with it right away:  No volume on device once any earbuds are removed and had to hard start it to get sound back (happened often). Videos which were deleted were still taking up storage on the device even though I couldn't actually access the deleted video any longer.  Had to force stop apps and restart; device frozen/unresponsive.  Had to do factory reset.  Kept calling Mayday, which is a great concept except that when you have to power down to fix something Mayday disconnects.  Problems with Wifi (would drop or show as only 1 bar while my Kindle Fire HD had full wifi bars and never drops). Videos slower to download than on my HD.  I expected the HDX would be "better" based on the advertising; I think it would be if everything works as promised.  Finally, when I had no volume again and it had crashed the night before, I called Amazon and requested a replacement.  Today, received a REFURBISHED HDX to replace the 40-day old HDX.  Not acceptable Amazon!  I paid for a NEW HDX.  Refurbished can be a good option when you pay the cost of a refurbished device.  I am returning the replacement (the refurbished HDX) and am also returning the HDX I bought 40 days ago.  Amazon originally stated because I am past the 30 days they would only refund 80% of HDX cost, not 100%.  Guess I should not have been patient in trying to make the HDX work - should have returned it immediately.  Amazon has agreed now to refund 100% once they receive the returned items.  All of my frustration could be avoided if they would have sent me a NEW replacement, not refurbished (AND offered to do it before the 30 days expired when I was calling "Mayday" every few days).  Not cool, Amazon!  The lesson I learned:  If your HDX doesn't work perfectly immediately, send it back, don't be patient.  I also learned that Amazon customer service is not as terrific as I had once thought they were.Updated comment:  When I finally received my refund,  it wasn't the full amount expected.  Amazon imposed a restocking fee.  I had to call them, explain my situation again and  request the restocking fee be refunded.I did end up ordering a new HDX and paid in full for it.  It works great and I'm happy with it.  However, note that when the first HDX was purchased, I bought it on an installment plan being offered at the time.  Two weeks ago they charged me the second installment on the returned (first) HDX.  I had to call Amazon, explain the situation again and they are "working on reversing" that installment.  Guess we will see whether the third and fourth installments get charged in error too.

Reviews.Title: not worth the money
Reviews.Author: christian s. sutton
Reviews.Content: I returned my hdx after I used it and encountered issue after issue with the software.  The browser crashed repeatedly just registering the device. I rebooted several times then factory reset it to no avail.  after I finally got it past the registration process i went on the kindle store to download some apps (with fingers crossed) and it crashed. I then realized that the browser was the issue ( or at least net communication was). to give an examle: if I wanted the simle Google home page it would take literally 1-2 minutes to load!!!!!! I then decided only to use it (stripped of adding any apps or using the silk browser) as a simple book reader. i got online with my laptop and researched if people were experiencing the same issues and they were.  people had advice of disable this or that or even deleting the whole operating system in favor of something more friendly. after about a week I got frustrated of not being able to ref things on the net from the technical docs and textbooks I read while using it and decided to return it. I played way too much money for that kind of functionality.

Reviews.Title: The best device I've ever owned... even though Silk is horrible.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've read a few of these reviews and I've had my HDX since release day. Here is my take on this, my second Kindle Fire. I've been waiting on a tablet with decent resolution that will play HD video smoothly... I tried a few different tablets for this and I was dissatisfied with the video display or the smoothness of the rendering.My search is over. The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is a marvel. The color reproduction is fantastic - truly, you have to see this with your own eyes to really appreciate how stunning this display looks. HD video streamed from Amazon Prime is so good I almost prefer watching on this screen over my TV. My laptop looks like a piece of junk next to this... not to mention the sound! WOW! It's loud, clear, without being overly tinny. Again, blows all three of my laptops out of the water. My wife and I just watched an episode of Firefly streamed from Prime (yes!) with it sitting on a stool while we were on a couch and it both sounded and looked great!The camera is far better than I expected - even the forward facing camera is of solid quality. But, considering this isn't why I bought the tablet, I haven't really run the camera through any real paces.Bluetooth connection is solid. I've connected my headphones and a song sheet pedal (to switch between pages on chord charts for guitar) and both devices paired and worked as expected with no problems.I've actually used the Mayday feature twice - both times I was connected within a minute to someone who was cheerful and ready to assist. Best tech support experience I've ever had. Maybe it's because you can actually see these people (though they can't see you), they were professional and courteous and seemed genuinely interested in my issue with a desire to help me fix the problem.Turns out they'll have to send me a new Fire because my issue seems hardware related (lock screen image never changes and I've had two random restarts and a force close on the Store). So... do you see that... even WITH those issues, I'm incredibly pleased with this device. I have spent HOURS on this thing, reading, listening, playing games, watching videos, downloading content, editing documents, taking notes... and except for the few times I mentioned... this thing has been flawless.This is one of the best electronic devices I have ever purchased.So... glowing review... why only 4 stars? The browser. Silk is simply terrible. Sideload Dolphin HD and sideload Flash... you will be sorely disappointed with your web browsing experience if you don't. To this day I'm still not sure why Amazon isn't just allowing Dolphin to be installed from the app store. Having to sideload a browser is the only downside to this.

Reviews.Title: This is third kindle fire The first lemmon!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Allen
Reviews.Content: I had the original kindle fire, also the kindle fir HD They performed fine.The Kindle fire 8.9 HDX with 4G LET and 64 GIG. is worthless it crashes every minute or less.  It crashes when your on the web.  It crashes when your using it to play angry birds or anything.  It crashes when you are on pulse.  It crashes, crashes, crashes.  Mayday sent me to customer service who eventually said they would get back to me at the time they gave up plus 24 hours later. 24 hours came and went I heard nothing.  I contacted them. I was told it would take a few days.  Days have come and gone I've heard nada nothing.  They have just ignored the problem and me not even a we are still working on it acknowledgment that there is an issue.  With allof the

Reviews.Title: Everything and more!
Reviews.Author: Ray F. Bridenbaugh
Reviews.Content: This is my first electronic toy.  My telephone is so basic that it does not even take pictures.  The Kindle HDX 8.9 is fast, clear beautiful pictures and easy to program.  I have discovered the joy of apps!  I expected to use it as a reader but it is so much more.  One week and I have loaded books, newspapers, news, weather, music, calculator,  lessons of various types ,etc, etc, etc.  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX
Reviews.Author: Nancy A. Hasenpflug
Reviews.Content: This is my seventh Kindle and third Kindle Fire.  Obviously, I am a fan.  As a Prime Member, the Kindle Fire HDX makes total sense.  I can download or stream my prime videos, borrow books from the lender library and shop Amazon easily.  As for the HDX itself, of my goodness, it is fantastic.  It is super light, the display is amazing, and it is unbelievably fast. I bought mine to include the special offers, not so much to save money on the unit, but to save money of some of the things offered.  I highly and enthusiastically  recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: So, if I really wanted to rate this a '1', why did I rate it a '3'?
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Jacoby
Reviews.Content: While this appears to be a nicely-engineered device, it broke within 24 hours.  Not exactly what we call "High Quality".So, why did I rate it a '3' instead of a '1'?First, let's go over the problems.1) While the device was supposed to have 64 GB of storage, it ran out of storage after downloading 6 movies.  My rule of thumb is that an HD movie takes around 4.5 GB of storage, so WTF?  When I talked to the Amazon Help Desk rep, he agreed that this shouldn't have been a problem.2) When attempting to remove movies from the device, it didn't just freeze, it turned into a brick.  Nothing I did (under the Amazon agent's direction, mind you) fixed it.  Nothing like a $500 brick.3) The menus are not intuitive.  I've seen better GUIs designed by freshmen college students.4) The size of the menu items are VERY SMALL... barely readable with my 62 year-old eyes, and I inadvertently selected the wrong item twice in a row.  There appears to be no way to change the font size of the selectable items.5) There's no way to Search to find downloadable movies.  It's just "click each item until you can download it".  There ought to be a better way to find items that you can download without a random Drunkard's Walk.So, if the Kindle Fire HDX is so bad, why did I rate it a '3'?Well, normally the "Brick after less than 24 hours" would make it a '1', but I like the potential for the device.  As with my initial purchase of a Kindle Paperwhite, it appears that Amazon releases products before they've undergone sufficient testing.  However, Amazon has the BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE I've ever seen.  Their agents are well-trained, and capable of responding to hostile / unhappy customers, and they move heaven-and-earth to fix problems / dis-satisfactions.  I've already shipped the Kindle back to Amazon, and they've already shipped me a replacement device.  Unfortunately, I'll be in Europe when it arrives, but I can't fault Amazon for their response.Bottom Line?  I'm a fan of the company, even if their initial product rollouts suck.For you early adopters, be aware that the quality may be substandard.  However, the potential for the Kindle Fire HDX makes this a device worth purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Simply a great tablet experience
Reviews.Author: EvansDJ82
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is a great tablet.  Fantastic screen, super responsive, and super easy to use.PS, this does not suffer from the blue haze that the 7 inch does because it uses white LEDs.

Reviews.Title: Same old wifi issue....so sad.
Reviews.Author: KRL77 "KRL77"
Reviews.Content: I'm so sad to have to write this. I've always been a HUGE Amazon fan. I thought their customer support was stellar. I received the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 for Christmas and LOVED it. Then...started to run into the same wifi issues I'm reading many customers have had. I have an "excellent strength" signal (according to the setting on my Kindle) however, it is telling me it's not connected. The only thing that works is rebooting the device, and even that is only a temporary fix. I'm getting the run-around from tech support. It's been over a week and I have no resolution to my problem. I'm so disappointed. I would not be able to recommend this device, I have purchased Kindle products since their inception and this is the first one I've had an issue with.

Reviews.Title: Five Star Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Winston Kindle
Reviews.Content: I was a Kindle Fire version 1 user since it came out. Used it and loved it, great little machine!  I waited for a major upgrade and finally the 8.9 HDX arrived.  I have mine and it is everything I expected.  I have every app on this machine, including Google earth, maps search (incl voice),drive, Gmail, adobe flash on dolphin browser and Opera is also installed, Many of these apps were put on thru 1mobile or mobogenie. There are a few little hiccups but nothing that causes me any concern.  There are workarounds for installing most of the apps that are not in the Amazon app store. Look on the internet to find these.This tablet's screen is outstanding, the colors are bright, beautiful. The sound is wonderful, the only thing that bugs me is the lack of a good case, I saw the Origami case at Best Buy, not to my liking. I am sure a better, cheaper case is coming.  The screen needs a good easy screen protector that is easy to install with no bubbles, I will wait for that also.  This is a Five Star tablet that does every thing I could ask it to do!

Reviews.Title: Amazon use advanced screen tech. On this tablet.
Reviews.Author: chiu-hsiung yang
Reviews.Content: Wonderful screen (with mirror reflection 6.8) is good for reading,good for eye, hurt eye less. It worths the price. Amazon use best screen material.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire baby!!
Reviews.Author: AM "love my kindle"
Reviews.Content: So very happy with my new baby, I cannot believe the difference in the slimness of this one compared to my other kindle fire 8.9. Still having to get used to the different locations of power button and volume controls. I really like how I now can choose a different voice to read my books. Color is amazing, sound still awesome. I'm also extremely glad the micro usb cord and power charger plug came with my order.

Reviews.Title: Amazon has hit the bullseye again with the new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 !!!
Reviews.Author: Nicholous
Reviews.Content: OMG, the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" WiFi is fantastic!  I loved my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and now I just can't believe how much faster, lighter and more intuitive the HDX is.  In reviews I've seen in online magazines and such almost always have the Kindle HDX come out on top of the competition ... Apple's IPad Air is trounced in nearly every aspect.  With the $79/year Prime membership, you can watch great movies and TV shows, with a huge selection being free (included in the Prime membership.)  Now you can actually download select videos to watch when out of WiFi range.  As always, the new Fire HDX includes the Amazon Lending Library which lets you borrow certain Kindle e-books for a month.  I have several TV series I follow on the Kindle and the screen resolution is just amazing.  I'm just blown away again by all the new Kindle Fire HDX has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Better than the horse I asked for one Christmas
Reviews.Author: Bookcruiser "Bookcruiser"
Reviews.Content: I waited like a kid on Christmas for my Kindle Fire 8.9" HDX to arrive and I am not disappointed. First the very cool product presentation box and then I opened it to find an adapter included with my treasure. I did a little dance of joy and then unwrapped my treasure. The setup was seamless and it was as easy to get around as my Fire HD. First order of the day was to enlarge the font and set all of my preferences. I admit I did get distracted playing Hearts and seeing new avatars. Back to the serious business and the keyboard which is easy to use and comfortable with my HDX sitting on my lap with my feet up on the ottoman. The response time is awesome! I used the camera to take a pic of me and my new toy and one of my computer monitor. I was curious if the color would be right and if light would be an issue with the photo. Both pictures turned out well but I went to edit to see all the cool things one can do if your want to edit your picture. The sound is clear with and without earphones. I also read part of a magazine to check on the print and color. Both are visually better than the Fire HD and my iPad with Retina. I am thrilled with my purchase except my Scrabble game from the HD is not available on the HDX. When I used Mayday, Steve dressed in a smile, shirt and tie was able to help me and offer hope. Thanks Amazon...great job!

Reviews.Title: Great for Entertainment, not so much for other uses.
Reviews.Author: lycanthrope
Reviews.Content: Received the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" as part of a free trial promotion done by Amazon.Things I liked:Display is outstanding, great for watching movies.Very light, much lighter then I was expecting.  Great to bring with you on the go and simply holding in your hand.Easy set up.  A few quick prompts and it was ready to go.  If you are getting this as a gift make sure you note that when you order it, otherwise it will automatically set up to your account.Things I didn't like:Amazon app store is lagging compared to Google's Play.  I previously had an Autocad WS app that I used on my phone, when I tried it on the Kindle Fire I was told I had to update it.  Unfortunately Amazon does not have the update on it's app store and it would not let me go elsewhere.  There is a way to get the apps as a quick search will tell you but I don't really want to pay this price and then have to do some work around.If all you want is something to keep you entertained then I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HDX especially if you are a Prime member.  It is very much improved over the original Kindle Fire that I got my wife when they first come out.If, like me, you want to use it for other things then I would keep on looking or at least make sure the apps you need are on Amazon.  I would up returning mine after a few days use, for me it simply was not worth the cost.  So if I returned it, why the five stars?  Well, I believe Amazon built this for entertainment, be it reading books or watching movies.  And in these areas it excels.  If Amazon ever gets their app store to be on par with Google's then I will definitely be looking at this again.  Until then, though, I didn't find it worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: Happy Gentleman in Florida
Reviews.Author: RODNEY CLEMENT
Reviews.Content: Just received my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  I am 75 years old, and I found this tablet to be a GEM.  If I can go through it and set it up in a matter of and hour or two, including downloads, e-mail etc, than anyone can do it, and didn't have to use May Day yet.  I have been looking for a tablet that is comfortable for me to use, and after a wide search both internet and the store, I am very pleased with my purchase.  You go Amazon, you have beat the others by a mile.  Happy that Amazon offered an excellent deal, and the price is just right.  Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love at first sight!
Reviews.Author: Time to Read "time to read"
Reviews.Content: So this is my 5th Kindle that I have purchased for myself and this one is the best of the bunch.  The UPS man delivered it today and it came beautifully wrapped.  When I opened the box, I was very happy to find that this version included the powerfast charger block unlike it's predecessor.  The HDX 8.9 is sleek, shiny and amazingly light!  The resolution and graphics are phenomenal.  The sound is fine for me for movies, videos and games.  In previous versions of the Kindle Fire, Silk has always been sluggish and froze a lot.  I have not had that problem at all, even when having 4 or more tabs open!  YAY!I have downloaded several of my books and the reading and coloration is fine just like previous versions.  Videos play nice, they are not choppy at all.  Downloads are still amazingly quick and the resolution and sound are awesome.  The App store seems to have picked up a bunch of new apps for this Kindle as well.  I am happy to report that Candy Crush works like a charm on my HDX 8.9 :DI was able to set up my social media sights quickly and easily along with several email accounts.  This was very easy to work through and no hassle at all.  The battery on it seems to be holding out fine with me playing around with it for the last 5 hours.Overall, I love the 8.9 HDX.  It does take a little getting used to though because the carousel is a bit different and the power and volume button are in odd places (on the back of the Kindle).  Oh and I did try both the front and rear camera the picture quality is clear, sharp and crisp!

Reviews.Title: i want to like it, but i cant
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: its a beautiful piece of technology, really fast and smooth, but i cant get myself to actually like using the device.the display is incredible, and it is unbelievably light. im used to the buttons on the backside as the tablet i got this to replace is a motorola xyboard 8.the software lacks certain things. its android with a heavily modded theme. android was created by google. why is there no google play store? there seems to be absolutely nothing to do with google on the device. i have been an android user since it came out with 2.0 on the first generation moto droid. everything i do on my phones, tablets, computers, is tied to g

Reviews.Title: Why I purchased and Why I sent it back, a non technical review.
Reviews.Author: Edward "Hockey Guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 64 GB, Case and square trade Warranty.My experience was it had a beautiful display and was fast. I wanted to like it since I have so much video media and books (eBooks and audio) purchased from amazon or amazon companies. I used the fire for a 10 hour bus trip and again on the way back. The battery lasted for the entire 10 hour trip and the fire was running about 75% of the time.As an entertainment device, movies, books, and audio it was very nice. I also loved the idea of downloading the movies and TV shows from amazon prime to watch off line when there wasn’t any internet available. With 64GB I had plenty of room to load my device with mp4 movies I already owned to watch later. Strange you have to use the photo app on the kindle to watch a downloaded mp4 movie.The email was very easy to set up and worked seamlessly with my work email, a big plus. I purchased excel contacts (5 Star app by Sam YU, samapp.net, in kindle store) to load all my contacts from my ios device to an excel spreadsheet then to my kindle.Why I sent mine back.The operating system supporting apps needs more time to mature. The apps I commonly used were not always available on the fire and there were no substitutes.A problem I had I tried using the mayday feature. I wanted to convert my ios calendars to use on the kindle. I have hundreds of appointments, birthdates, anniversaries etc. plugged into a calendar already and I was trying to convert it. I used mayday to get information, she had no help for me. Next step for mayday, I asked if I converted the ios calendar to a google calendar (information on the web on how to do this) how do I change it to the kindle calendar. I kept getting a repeated message, which I believe she was reading, "You can only use what is available in the kindle app store". I wrote to Sam Yu, one of the developers at, samapp.net. They have the excel contact app (in kindle store) but they also have a great excel calendar app which I have used on ios and was hoping they were close to one for the kindle. No luck.ConclusionThere weren’t enough PRIME movies or shows that I have not seen available for download. My main reason for purchasing the kindle hdx, to justify keeping the Kindle HDX. I also do not like you do not know if a movie or TV show can be downloaded until you click and open the movie options. Most of the newer movies and shows cannot and must be streamed and will not work without a fast internet connection. I had to spend a lot of time opening every movie or show to see which ones I could download to take on the bus with me. The internet provided at most places on the road, or on our bus, will not support streaming without the constant buffering stops.I ended up sending the kindle fire hdx back and purchased an IPad Mini retina. I’m pretty sure square trades will transfer the warranty over so I just pay the upgrade in price. They told me to call them directly. I have not given up and will most likely purchase a kindle fire, maybe the next version. Hopefully they continue to grow the apps and add more movies and shows to Prime.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, not as streamlined as iPad, much improved after software updates.
Reviews.Author: Docktw "Bookaholic"
Reviews.Content: So far, this is a great tablet with a very sharp screen and no blue edge like the 7" HDX has.  It's fast, lightweight, and easy to use.  My only minor quibbles are 1) the matte finish on the back cover already looks smudged and dinged up and I've had it for about 7 hours and handled it very gently 2) the kindle app does not let you organize your books into categories.  Even the iPhone and iPad Kindle apps and the original Kindle let you do that.  What were they thinking leaving this out of the software?  Honestly, the Kindle functionality was the main reason I chose the HDX over the iPad, so I'm kind of disappointed, but the Mayday person assured me it would be available in the software upgrade before the end of the year.  If not, I would have returned it, but the other features are so nice, I really don't want to do that.  The Mayday feature worked great, I got help within 10 seconds.  And there are more than enough apps for anybody to be happy.**Update** - I have a lot of movies on my computer and the only way to view them in the Kindle is under Videos - Personal Collection.  The way they are displayed is very stupid!  They are displayed graphically in a grid with the first still shot of the movie showing, and there is no way to organize them by title.  So if you want to watch a particular movie, you have to guess and keep opening movies until you find the one you want.  I asked Mayday for help and they said it's not possible to do it any differently.  This may be the straw that breaks the camel's back for me.  I may be returning it for the iPad (in which you can just import anything into iTunes) if I can't figure out a way around this.  Downgraded to 3 stars, feedback given to Mayday.***Update #2: I downloaded a program called ES3 which allows you to copy files to the HDX and you can sort them however you want.  Some movies won't play (it seems to be the ones purchased through iTunes) but I've been satisfied enough with this program that I didn't return the HDX.  And they have added a "Cloud Collections" function to the HDX finally.Now that these issues are resolved, I'm really giving it 4.5 stars, and the only reason for the 1/2 point deduction is because it is just not nearly as easy and streamlined as the iPad in terms of watching movies and listening to music.

Reviews.Title: It pains me to have to give this one star....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the most difficult one star review I've had to give. Usually a one star product is clearly junk, but that is not the case here.If I were to rate the hardware only (I bought the HDX 8.9 w/o special offers), I would say it's a five star product. But we can't just rate this on hardware alone, we have to look at both the software and Amazon's walled garden policies.I read all the reviews from the gadget sites about how this was somewhat crippled by lack of access to google play, but that you could sideload apps, and that if you wanted to consume Amazon content that it was a good choice. As all I wanted it for was to read ebooks, I thought it would be perfect. It has probably the best screen I've seen on a tablet (compared to my new Galaxy Note 2014 and my wife's Ipad Retina, the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is the better screen). The problem was I have a lot of technical ebooks (I'm a software developer) from Oreilly press, and I prefer PDF format for these. I also have a few ePub books. I did some research and found moon+ reader pro in the Amazon store. I figured I was good to go, I could buy Moon Reader + pro and have a device that could read all my kindle books, watch amazon prime, and read my ePubs and PDFs. Then the tablet came and I logged in to the store, and Moon Reader + Pro was not listed. I followed a link from the web and lo-and-behold it says "Not compatible with your device"..which was interesting because the free version worked just fine. I wanted the pro because It supports PDFs and the ads are annoying. I then looked for other readers in the Amazon store that would support ePub or PDF and work on my device and guess what...there weren't any. Interestingly enough, there are other readers in the Amazon store such as Aldiko..they just say they aren't compatible with the HDX 8.9.. if you sideload them from the web they work fine though so it's not a compatibility issue. It's Amazon putting artificial limits on what content you can easily view on a kindle device. I don't mind the lack of Google Play because I can understand Amazon not wanting to pay to license from Google or follow Google's policies. But when they have apps that work for what I want in their App store but they intentionally limit access to them to Kindle Devices because they allow ePub and PDF content I have a problem with that.In closing, I would say that if you want to consume Amazon content, an Apple Ipad is currently the best choice. You have full access to a huge selection of apps, and you get the ability to view Amazon Instant Video and you get Text To Speech in the kindle reader. I absolutely despise Apple products so it pains me to recommend them, but for Amazon content the Ipad is the best choice. Android is purposefully crippled by Amazon. They do not have an Instant Video app for Android (other than for the Kindle Fire) and they don't support Text To Speech for Android (again other than the Kindle Fire). As for me I returned the Kindle and bought a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition. I don't get prime videos, but I do get Netflix if I want and I've started looking elsewhere for books and movies.I originally started buying from Amazon because I liked the choice, I liked the customer service, and they made things easy. With this tablet, they have taken away the choice of content and nothing was easy. Customer service is the only thing left. I'll still shop at Amazon for almost everything else I buy, but my great opinion of them was tarnished by the whole experience and I probably won't buy another Kindle device. At least they made it very easy to return the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Clyde Layton
Reviews.Content: When they upgraded and downgraded the Kindle Fire HDX they removed the mini HDMI. This was one of the reasons I got the Kindle Fire HD was because of the HDMI connectivity to my TV. I could stream the movies and Amazon Prime from my Kindle to the TV. Now with the HDX I no longer have that ability. Might as well just get a Kindle e reader now. I will probable shelf this one and continue to use the HD. What were they thinking? The reason to upgrade to a newer device is more functionality not less. Their Product Management Team need a demerit.UPDATESpent about another $70 on this. Bought the Netgear Push2TV (From Amazon). Suppose to be Certified to work with the Kindle. I have issues with the picture pixelating. I would not recommend this Kindle. If you want a great Kindle get the Kindle Fire HD not the HDX. The HD2 is suppose to do mirroring and has the HDMI connection. The HDX seems to be a way for Amazon to separate you from your money. This is a shame as I really like Amazon and am a frequent customer. I also really like the Kindle HD and would recommend it to anyone. Again the Product Management Team really messed up on the HDX.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle a charm.
Reviews.Author: J&B; Reviews
Reviews.Content: I got a $50 promotion for using my Amazon Card. This deal made it possible to get my HDX 8.9 before Christmas. In typical Amazon fashion they under promised and over delivered. The item was listed to be delivered on 12/24 but was at my door 12/19. What an awesome device and design. This is my third Kindle and I was not sure I would be as impressed as I was when I got my HD 8.9 last year. The mayday button and new design were the deal breaker. Just one comment about the one star reviews of this product. 75% are complaining about the lack of Google Play store which Amazon has never supported in their Fire Generations so please SHUT UP and buy a Nexus.

Reviews.Title: much more more good than bad
Reviews.Author: dremlon
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that it randomly restarts from time to time, it's wonderful. The battery can be drained quite quickly if you're not careful. The rear facing camera is very nice and has a flash for all lighting pictures. It is lightning quick compared to other tablets I've had and the display is remarkable in all aspects.  There is no micro hdmi port on this tablet to write it up to your tv and the option to do that I actually loved on the previous hd version.  The Mayday button is surprisingly useful. I never thought I would use the feature, but 30 minutes out of the box I found myself hitting the button:)Pros:ScreenSpeedMayday buttonRear facing camera w/flashCons:Battery lifeRestarting troubles(could just be mine)Lack of micro hdmi portOverall a very nice buy

Reviews.Title: Glad I upgraded.
Reviews.Author: Mbail
