I have a reader as well and love it so I decided to go with a Kindle and I'm glad I did - nice products.

Reviews.Title: Amazing effort to create a great product
Reviews.Author: Ramon H. Pantoja "libros"
Reviews.Content: I've been using it for a few weeks now and I;m totally hooked.Definitely will keep it hopefully for a long time. Very quick access to my e-mails, calendar etc.It's becoming a necessary tool for my line of work.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, best image ever!
Reviews.Author: Bubu
Reviews.Content: I had this product for less than 30 days, I enjoyed having it and using it for many fun stuffs. The best I noticed was the quality of images, that included videos, movies, pictures, and browsing the internet.The stereo sound is so good even better when I plugged in my earphones!

Reviews.Title: Bumpy road but Amazon help got us there
Reviews.Author: Carrie Campbell
Reviews.Content: My daughter saved for a long time so that she might upgrade her device (she has an old Kindle Fire). With the help of some Christmas money from parents and grandparents she was able to get this nice 8.9" Kindle Fire HDX. She struggled with the decision, however, and did a lot of comparison shopping. She looked at reviews of both the iPad Mini (comparable in price to this device) and this Kindle Fire. She had to get the 8.9 to get the camera on both sides, which she wanted and the iPad mini has. The iPad mini was winning in her estimation and research, but what made her choose the Kindle was that she'd already spent so much time and energy over the many years of owning the Kindle Fire, advancing in her games and purchasing coins. I asked Help if everything from her Kindle Fire would transfer to the new Kindle Fire HDX and they said yes and failed to note exceptions to this. After getting the new device there ARE exceptions to this and they include your standings in Apps you already own and your coins. What? The whole reason she chose the Kindle Fire over the iPad mini. Two things happened to help her NOT return the Kindle, the help desk was helpful and worked hard to make things "right" for her on the new Kindle and she really does like the "feel" of this new Kindle. The HDX is light, easy to hold and does not "accidentally" touch the screen when you are playing games, which is something she notices a lot on her friends iPad Mini. We have had one situation of a frozen screen and we will keep an eye on this over the next couple of weeks to see if it happens again. Hopefully, no. The Help desk is easily accessible, however, and responsive so if the screen freezes again we will hopefully get some help and be able to fix it rather than have to exchange the Kindle. In the end, the Kindle design and the Amazon support saved the day and has made my daughter very happy, and me too because I got her some nice accessories for Christmas to go with it!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Jacob Garcia
Reviews.Content: great look feel great apps great movies with amazon prime can not go wrong cheaper then an ipad mini and works better pick one up if you can

Reviews.Title: better than my first Kindle and I could'nt do without my first one
Reviews.Author: Jim E. Stone
Reviews.Content: I still read my first kindle but when I can get a good leather cover for  my 8.9 I will use it alltogether

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I just received it.  I am impressed with the service, the speed of response, and the bonu is talking to nice people who are very helful.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Jean Wheeler
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase.  It's fantastic and I use it every day.  I highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Crystal Peoples
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HDX.  I am learning new things about it each day.  Since submitting my initial rating, I have no idea why my reasoning did not show up, but I have learned how to adjust text to speech voice speed.  The other issues I had were the inability to print web pages and the fact that the text to speech tends to stop at the beginning of a new chapter.  The volume is fine indoors but inside of a car, the road sounds tend to make it difficult to hear text to speech unless you have the device in your lap which is risky while driving.  In certain books, text to speech repeats the last word in a sentence.  This can be annoying.  I imagine I use text to speech more than the average person.  Other than my listed issues, I have no problem with the device.  I was told that Amazon is working on web printing and the text to speech new chapter stopping.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Redhot
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet. So glad I chose this one. Lots of apps to pick from. Downloads are quick. Been easy to figure out everything.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Michael T Iocca
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that someone is able to help you at any time of the day with the May Day button.I love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet - highly recommended
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet.  Bought the HD 7" in Jan.2013 & there is such a difference between the two. I ordered the 7 HDX 32gb online (not thru Amazon) & the store grabbed the wrong box & I ended up with the 8.9" HDX 32gb, which was even better because I saved myself 200.00 some dollars & got a better tablet.  The 8.9 HDX is very comparitive to the Nexus 10 which is also an excellent tablet, but about a $100.00 less than the 8.9 HDX 32bg.  I may be selling my 7" HD Kindle on ebay & maybe even the Nexus, because the Nexus & 8.9 HDX are the same in all qualities & specifications.  The HDX 8.9 is easy to use, light, good screen quality to watch movies & play games & I especially like the power button.  I recommend this to buy along with the Nexus 10

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Marianne Brown
Reviews.Content: It has a beautiful display.  I really loved it except for the fact that it froze up on me 4 times  in one week.  Also, certain games that I wanted were not formatted yet for the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Super Terrific!!!
Reviews.Author: IJL "IJL"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle Fire and still enjoy all three.  Super products!The newest Kindle Fire  I have is the HDX 8.9" and my others are HD 7" and HD 8.9"; each one has its own selling points and addresses a  variety of people---young, old, computer gurus and not so guru!!  Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love the Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: A. Scott
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire.  I have each of the other versions (!) and think this one is outstanding.  I love the MayDay button and being able to download TV shows and movies.

Reviews.Title: love all my kindles
Reviews.Author: Carla,
Reviews.Content: I love it,  love how clear the images are.  It does everything I wanted and more. I did not go ad free, they are just fine on opening page only.

Reviews.Title: The Mayday Button
Reviews.Author: OP
Reviews.Content: Have to admit.  The Mayday button raises the bar in great customer service for other companies to aspire to.  A bright idea!

Reviews.Title: It's a great thing to own.
Reviews.Author: Richard Franks
Reviews.Content: It's fast - it's big - it's easy to use - the mayday button is fabulous - - - I've retired my big computer for everyday use and I use this little beauty instead!

Reviews.Title: good sevice got it right on time i pre ordered it. very happy.
Reviews.Author: KRISTY R VANTASSELL
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my son for Christmas to upgrade his old kindle fire not hd. I love it quite a improvement I like playing on it and don't want to wrap it till I have to so I can keep using it. May have to get my own.

Reviews.Title: Really Versitile
Reviews.Author: Eugene M Steinfeld
Reviews.Content: Really versatile . Seems little I can't do with it, especially after sideloading other Android apps. Really fast and light.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds my Expectations!
Reviews.Author: Lloyd Malone
Reviews.Content: Beautiful screen; easy and intuitive to use; has everything I need; terrific customer service; connections to Amazon are very consumer friendly.Many of my friends have I-Pads...I think the HDX is much better and of course, less expensive.I am extremely pleased!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx headline
Reviews.Author: David Jacobo
Reviews.Content: It froze once within the first week of use. Other than that I think it's amazing. I can only hope that it won't freeze too often.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend! Very easy to use - even for a beginner!!
Reviews.Author: Win-Lin
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with ease of use and clarity of photos! I am learning quickly. This is my first tablet experience. I don't even have a Smart Phone! Great product!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" HDX Fits My Needs
Reviews.Author: S. W. Starnes
Reviews.Content: This Kindle does everything I need it to do: books, games, internet, mail, etc.  With my Amazon Prime membership, I can stream movies to my TV via a blue ray device.  It's fast.  It's clear.  I used the help feature to have someone help me sync my Kindle with my blue ray player.  Very cool.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs.
Reviews.Author: Mike W. Hoffman "hoff7273"
Reviews.Content: I use it mainly for watching movies on Netflix and managing my fantasy football teams.  I've been in and out of the hospital this year so it's nice to have something to watch movies on without lugging my $2000 laptop around.

Reviews.Title: Wow and awesome.
Reviews.Author: Victor B Stanley
Reviews.Content: Wow. This a awesome reader and more. I find that I'm using it more than my laptop for everyday task. It's fast and responsive. The Mayday feature works as advertised. Good thing I don't have wifi at work I would probably use it in the middle of the night. Seriously a awesome buy well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: another great idea
Reviews.Author: In My Old Age "Jean"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th kindle , best reader s around and the HD & HDX great as tablet for browsing. Haven't had this one long, seemed slow but has updated and is much better now.love this larger size. I removed the ads after received. Only issue now is on button but that's with otter box case on it, so not kindle fault. Looking forward to Mayday ability, wish only we could request who we get( I vote for a good lookin guy with sexy accent).

Reviews.Title: Very Very Happy with discission.
Reviews.Author: meowpal
Reviews.Content: So far everything I have tried to do with the Kindle, has worked perfectly.  I even used the mayday button one time and got a very fast and helpful response.  Solved my question immediately.  My daughter has an I Pad, and so far I am glad I chose the Kindle instead.

Reviews.Title: Basic features, overview ; even better than the Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jenraider72 "Jen"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1QMRB5A0ATU26', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1QMRB5A0ATU26loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; I use my Kindles mainly for watching videos and tv, as well as web browsing, shopping via Amazon and very occasionally checking email when not near my laptop or pc. My daughter, who is 12, is constantly using my other Kindle, so it's a good tablet for kids- very easy to use with the added security of parental control options. Something I neglected to mention in the video is the placement of the power and volume controls which are now located on the back of the tablet, along the beveled edge. I find this to be an improvement over the prior Fire HD version, on which these were located flush with the tablet's right side edge, making them somewhat cumbersome to use without feeling around or actually looking at them.

Reviews.Title: Super Display! Doesn't take long for even a novice to get up and running.
Reviews.Author: Michael "mikamu1"
Reviews.Content: I'm new to the Android scene, so it's not as intuitive to me as I could ask for.  Beautiful quality product, excellent screen.  We planned on using this mostly for reading and study, but find it handy for the ? that comes up during a movie or new event.  I'm sure there will be more to add later, since we're pretty new at it.Only complaint has to do with app availability - Went to JW.org to get their new library app and found that Kindle is one of the few it won't work on yet.??.  What's up with that?  Seems like all the other major Tablets have no issues.  Please check it out as this is a major study tools that would save us tons of time not having to be on the internet.  This is the main reason I went with 64GB.Thanks for a great product.The HDMI connect from the older model is not on this new one.  We had looked forward to downloading movies for direct plug-in to our TV. Will have to see if there is a workaround to avail ourselves of this feature.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: mgw
Reviews.Content: Upgraded my 1st generation kindle fire and what an improvement. Picture quality is fantastic and the Dolby speakers sound great.Silk web browser is fast and responsive. Light weight and nicely placed on and volume buttons. This is a great tablet that is sure to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HDX
Reviews.Author: nicholr gibson
Reviews.Content: I chose the kindle because there is so much that you can do besides reading books there are learning games for my son and I can also watch movies with my prime membership

Reviews.Title: Really wanted to love
Reviews.Author: dcbag
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be able to use with Fire TV but print was not bold or large enough to read, really liked being able to record prime and watch later, did not like not being able to use play store. Had to return, then purchased a 10" Sony tablet, really like it, but can't watch or record prime videos.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Bonnie L. Munn "Bonnie"
Reviews.Content: This one is the best of the lot.  I have found 16 GB more that sufficient to meet my needs and I use it everyday.  I especially like the size.  It is just right for watching movies, yet portable enough for my bag.  It has a great camera (front & rear facing).  I purchased it when it was 10% off and with my Amazon points and a gift card I paid (including tax) less that $300.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Jim King
Reviews.Content: I really like the quality of the picture on my new Kindle. I had the smaller version which I like, but the larger version just blows it out of the water. More than I expected!Once again the shipping was far better than I even imagined! Amazon never fails to impress me!

Reviews.Title: Really awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Huntington Appraisal Service
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who had an older style Kindle.  She absolutely love this Kindle Fire.  The screen color resolution is great and it is outstanding for reading books.

Reviews.Title: great device.
Reviews.Author: Gerald Vineyard
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HDX.  It's very easy to use.  The pictures are Crystal clear and the sound is wonderful.  M y older fire didn't have the ability to play flash content.  This one has an alternative viewer that fills that need.  My primary need was a reader.  This device surpasses all of my requirements in that category.  Reading on this is device is a joy.  I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Love It.
Reviews.Author: ziegler
Reviews.Content: I really love this Kindle, I use it for reading, playing games and surfing the web. It does everything I need and more. I highly recommend it. I own 3 different kindles love all 3. And yes I use them all.

Reviews.Title: Average at best.
Reviews.Author: Timothy B Bjornestad
Reviews.Content: I love amazon, and have been a Prime member for years. The HDX is a great deal in terms of content if you are already an Amazon prime member, and the quality of the screen is INCREDIBLE!However, I've found that many of the applications that I've loved on other platforms are not specifically adjusted to run well on this device. The touch parameters are off, the resolution is suspect, or the application simply won't work at all. Try THE GAME OF LIFE or Scribblenauts on it and you'll see what I'm talking about in a matter of minutes.THE ABSOLUTE WORST ASPECT OF ALL -- THE BROWSER!!! You are unquestionably limited to less than half of the I the internet because of scripting errors that arise when trying to load videos or simple page content. It is incredibly and outrageously frustrating. One last note, I wrote this using my KF HDX - please excuse any possible spelling errors.Great quality device, but until the browser is updated and applications are refined, I insist that you stick with your IPad.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: book lover
Reviews.Content: I debated over whether to get a Kindle Fire HDX or an iPad Air, but after reading comparison reviews and considering the weight, the price value for 32 gigabytes, and screen resolution, I went for the KIndle. After spending several hours today playing with my new "toy', I'm convinced the Kindle is the right choice for me. The screen resolution is spectacular, battery life is great (even with WiFi on and the brightness set at around 80%), the sound the best of all the tablets I already owned, the ease of use, the lightning fast processing, the app choices, and the totally AWESOME Mayday feature (which I only needed to use once during the setup), all terrific! I just love it!

Reviews.Title: THE PERFECT COMPANION FOR SENIOR CITIZENS
Reviews.Author: Mary A. Jarrell
Reviews.Content: I WANTED ONE WHEN I SAW PEOPLE USING THEM EVERYWHERE.I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT IT.I ACTUALLY BOUGHT TWO.  MY HUSBAND HAS WANTED TO LEARN HOW TO USE A COMPUTER FOREVER AND HIS KINDLE IS THE PERFECT WAY TO LEARN THE CONCEPT.  HE IS HARD OF HEARING AND WITH EARPHONES HE IS HEARING EVERYTHING.  HE HAS BEEN GLUED TO IT WATCHING VIDEOS (1940'S AND 50'S) RADIO AND TELEVISION AND LISTENING TO MUSIC FROM THE 50'S AND 60'S. IN OTHERWORDS IT'S BEEN A GODSEND FOR HIM.  HE'S RESEARCHED INFORMATION HE HAS WANTED TO KNOW AND HE HAS READ MORE SINCE HE GOT IT THAN I SAW HIM READ IN THE LAST 44 YEARS.

Reviews.Title: Tried to purchase a book and couldn't even do that!
Reviews.Author: Frank Willett
Reviews.Content: I have had it for about a month and get frustrated every time I have used it. NO USER DOCUMENTATION.  I have a couple hundred books that I had nicely organized on my old Kindle.  Have tried a couple of times to organize them on the new one and failed miserably.  Talked to a "May Day" person who recommended a use's guide book which I purchased.  It was no help what so ever.  Told me how to use the Kindle with my computer, transfer movies to the TV for viewing, use the Kindle as a telephone, etc.  All I want from my Kindle is a device for storing and reading my books.  I am disappointed.  I do need all of the features this kindle has.  I already have cameras, smart phones, computers, an iPad, etc.  I liked the functionality of my old kindle better.  Perhaps if I ever figure out how to buy, read and store books on the new one I will start using it on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: silk browser not working
Reviews.Author: Sylbasia "Sylvia"
Reviews.Content: There were many emails b/w me and CS Phylicia about the problem with my silk browser, and she said that she would let me know the results and solution. But she just ignored me.  After about 10 days I got an email from guy name Faisal asking for another day to try to fix it and when another 2 days passed no-one called me.  However. I love kindle and the Amazon,  so I returned the broken one and ordered the new one.  So far, So good.  It working just fine.  Just after I received my new Kindle,  Phylicia left a message and was asking about a status of my broken kindle,  really?  I have  New one already. YOU ARE ALLING ME 2 WEEKS AFTER? You are lucky that I I love Amazon and I am a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: Only one "but"
Reviews.Author: Joe from LA
Reviews.Content: This has to be the most amazing device of its kind. The USB port is a major plus. The range of free apps is impressive. Moving between languages (Spanish/English) is easy. So why 4 stars? The 24/7 instant help feature is marvellous, but not the competence of the techs. I have called many times because I wanted to know all the ins and outs of the product. Most of the techs were great, but not all. One was marginal and one was embarrassingly incompetent. Don't hesitate to get a second opinion if you are not convinced. Got my new one on EBay. Hint.

Reviews.Title: Best device on the market
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Vincent
Reviews.Content: This I my third Kindle.  I like to update every few years.  The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", with Wi-Fi is the best.  Really cannot say enough about it.  Books, Books on tape, movies and TV shows, etc., it does it all and then some.  I will always stick with the Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Good for media consumption.
Reviews.Author: darin harvey
Reviews.Content: What are you going to use your tablet for?  I did a bit of research on the different kinds of tablets available and most guides I read suggested considering a variation of this question.  I use my tablet primarily for media consumption.  My primary concern was picking a tablet that streamed videos through my Amazon Prime account. This left me with two choices: the Kindle Fire HDX or an iPad.  I chose the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 over the iPad Air because I could get the 64 GB Kindle for less than a 16 GB iPad Air.  I was also disappointed with the letter boxing on the iPad Air when it played HD movies.  While the Kindle has a smaller screen than the iPad Air, it has a bigger picture when watching movies than the iPad.  Perhaps the iPad uses more of the screen when playing TV shows and older movies, I don't know, but it only uses a portion of the screen when playing newer movies in HD.  The Kindle Fire HDX uses the entire screen when playing HD movies.  I regularly use Netflix, Amazon streaming, and Hulu Plus and have no complaints with the HDX's performance on this front.  The speakers are more than adequate for watching movies and listening to music.  I have no experience with other tablet speakers so I can't make a comparison, but the HDX speakers are well placed, clear, loud, and don't sound tinny.  Reading on the HDX is very easy.  I have the Nook, Aldiko, Moon+ Reader, and Comixology apps, and of course the Kindle App is pre-loaded on the HDX.  The HDX is quite light and easy to hold, in either portrait or landscape mode, for extended periods of time.  I'm very happy with the battery life as well.  I get 13 hours on a full charge.  On weekdays, after work, I can use the HDX for two days in a row before I have to think about plugging it in.  On weekends the tablet will last an entire day of almost constant use before needing to be charged.  I've only ran the battery down to 0% once, and I think it took a little over six hours to reach 100%.The biggest problem with the Kindle Fire HDX is the app store.  Since the Kindle Fires are closed off from the Google Play store I thought Amazon would focus on quality over quantity with regards to apps offered, but that doesn't seem to be the case.  There seems to be an abundance of cheap, poorly designed apps and a noticeable absence of certain popular apps.  The 1Mobile Market rectifies this a bit, but I still find the absence of some popular apps in the Amazon app store curious.  I would like a Google Drive app, but have to settle with accessing it through the browser.  With a little bit of research, I've found workarounds for most problems, but it's annoying to not have simple, direct access to apps other tablets have.  I'm also not a big fan of the carousel on the home screen, but I suppose some people may prefer it.The Kindle Fire HDX has some real limitations, but on the whole I am happy with my purchase.  If you want to use your tablet for work, you may want to do some more research to make sure the Kindle Fire will do want you need.  If you want a portable media player to watch movies, play music, browse the internet, and read books the Kindle Fire HDX is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it. Too bad.
Reviews.Author: Nurturer69
Reviews.Content: I have a 7" Kindle Fire and with the sound turned up high, the sound is actually LOUD. But with this Kindle, the highest setting is like a third of the sound level of my Kindle Fire - the older version Kindle. Speaker size perhaps or ohms level, as this Kindle is half as thin as my Kindle Fire, perhaps is the reason. Whatever the reason, and to be sure there is a reason, the sound quality is weak. Know that going in.I do like the light weight. The size is nice for reading. But again, I would have expected that this being the newest, 'better' Kindle, Amazon's most expensive, would have been OUTSTANDING in every way. Obviously, they know how to do it. So . . . why is the sound weak. A disappointment.UPDATE: I returned the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", for poor quality speaker sound. I believe if you purchase lower quality and keep it, it means you agree to the low quality. On another note, the Amazon reps were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: ****BLUETOOTH FEATURE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH iPHONE****
Reviews.Author: Plain & Simple
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not the type to complain however comma this is to be viewed as informing the prospective consumer.. NOT a complaint.That being said, the bells & whistles on this product are really cool.  Great display & very user friendly/intuitive.  My purpose for purchasing this device is to connect wirelessly (via bluetooth) to watch video on the screen & listen to the audio with a variety of bluetooth enabled devices.  It was difficult enough to find in the description of this product whether it was bluetooth capable or not.  My error for thinking a bluetooth enabled device will connect to another bluetooth enabled device -- this is not the case.Unfortunately, the Kindle Fire is not compatible in connecting via bluetooth with the Apple iPhone 5 (iOS 7).  Amazon tech support stated that the device will not connect via bluetooth to any Apple device since Apple is a competitor.The rep at Amazon suggested calling in advance to find out what devices the Kindle Fire is compatible with before purchasing.  I have a difficult time understanding why Amazon would not simply include a chart in the product description that outlines which devices the Kindle Fire is bluetooth compatible with and which ones it is not compatible with... that's my two cents worth!Other than that, contacting Amazon's tech support was easy & the rep was extremely helpful in assisting me with processing the return.Peace

Reviews.Title: Enthusiasts AVOID!
Reviews.Author: Christopher M Kenney
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that the Kindle Fire is barely 'okay' for what it is intended as - a media player.  The carousel interface is kind of neat, but more often gets in the way of finding the content you want to use at than assists in it.  That it tries very hard to direct you into purchasing new things rather than letting you get to things you have already bought and now want to use just makes it worse.  While some of the features can't be had anywhere else due to Amazon licensing terms (and the only reason this isn't getting 1 star) you know who you are if you want these.While I'll agree that a media player needs a nice screen, and this certainly has it, the problem is that the rest of its' technical specs are complete overkill for the job at hand.  You simply don't need quad-core, dedicated graphics, or massive internal storage if all you're going to be doing is reading books offline and streaming movies.  And boy, do they want you to stream over downloading.This is even further hampered by several bizarre decisions in the design.  Rear-facing speakers make it difficult to hear the thing even in relatively quiet environments without turning it up to the point where you will bother other people.  The keyboard and dictionary features are weak compared to Google's and Apple's offerings, making the touchscreen keyboard a pain to use effectively.  And the internal power management means that it often can't take advantage of the increased battery life - playing an HD movie drains the battery FASTER than a power cable can supply it.The Amazon app store is a complete joke.  My last tablet was an HP Touchpad, and before I installed Cyanogenmod the app store for THAT had easier, cheaper access to needed features.  When compared to Google Play and iTunes you just have to laugh.If all you're looking for is a cheap way to get access to Amazon content, consider the Kindle Fire HD - at over 200 bucks cheaper the minimal loss of resolution is probably justified, and you can actually connect that directly to an HDTV instead of needing an expensive new wireless setup of questionable utility (another strike against the HDX).  If you want a full-featured tablet, look at the iPad Air or one of the new KitKat-based Android tablets that should be coming out soon.Only buy the HDX if you seriously can't live without the ability to download a small subset of Prime-access videos.

Reviews.Title: Would be 5 stars except....
Reviews.Author: Don Weber
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely done product, but not quite as intuitive as the iPad. It's easy once you've spent some time with it. The display is the centerpiece of the Kindle. It is razor sharp and gorgeous. It would be five stars except, the most irritating thing about it is, the continual dropping of the wireless signal. We only use it at home and once it drops the signal, it either has to be turned on/off, or by switching the airplane mode on and off. I contacted Kindle tech services and they had no clue as to why this is happening. There is much written about this problem on the internet. Amazon needs to recognize it and come up with a fix. I know it's not my router, because our iPad 2 and Sony desktop, never have this problem. It's still a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not what we hoped for
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Price "PhantomRebekah"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom so she could play games, Facebook, and check emails without having to fire up her computer (Windows 8 is confusing for her). It's a decent size for her, but you really need a case to hold it successfully. Here are the issues we have:1. It doesn't hold its internet connection. It says the WiFi is working & signal strength is excellent, but then it won't even connect to Amazon. To solve this, you must shutdown & restart. My plain old Kindle Fire doesn't have this issue.2. The Mayday button was the one reason this wonout over cheaper & larger screen options. The button is buried in tiny type on the menu.3. Tiny type. Vision-impaired persons who aren't  computer wizards may never be able to read Facebook or numerous other websites. Trying to enlarge something using the same technique you'd  use on your phone doesn't work here.We had to send the first Kindle back because it wouldn't hold a charge for more than 2 hours of idle time. We got a replacement within one day; however, the didn't send a new charger. They gave a credit so we could order it & promised to refund the cost of next day shipping within 3 days. I sent an email a month later asking what happened to the credit & it was posted to my bank account the next day.So overall, the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is a bit disappointing, but the customer service of Amazon is quite good.

Reviews.Title: the jury is still out on this one
Reviews.Author: JulieMontana
Reviews.Content: Arrived as promised with packaging in excellent condition. Within 5 minutes, I had the Kindle Fire HDX turned on, connected to my wifi, it knew it belonged to me, and had my email set up. By far the quickest start-up of any device I have had. After having it a while, I do have issues with the fact that it will not let a number of my music cd's transfer correctly. I am gathering it is because they are mwav files. Using the Mayday button did not provide a lot of help. The wait for help was less than 15 seconds, but the assistant did not have any ideas why I could not see a number of my cds on the Kindle at the same time I could see through my laptop that they were in the Kindle internal storage in the music folder. He suggested I download the Cloud player, put my music on the cloud, and listen from the cloud. After several attempts to download the Cloud player to my laptop using internet explorer, I eventually got it to download properly using Google Chrome. Then I discovered you can only have 250 songs on the cloud without paying the $24.99 fee to put more music on the cloud. After picking and choosing what music to send to the cloud, I then found out you can't download from the cloud to the Kindle, you have to transfer from the laptop. Useless.  The Amazon cloud player would not accept about 20% of the songs I tried to transfer due to the wrong format(I think that is the issue, anyway). That is how I then looked at the properties of the tracks on the CDs and discovered the ones that would not transfer were all mwav files (windows media) so they must somehow be incompatible with the Kindle (or protected) not sure. So it appears my music issue is not just a Kindle issue, but an Amazon issue. Anyway, I am not happy with the fact that I can't put a lot of my music on the Kindle Fire HDX. That is why I have given it 4 stars instead of 5. I have been overall happy with the Apps I have downloaded. The location of the power and volume buttons is difficult to get used to. The screen has stellar resolution, and reading books is easy. I have not downloaded any movies to comment on viewing those videos.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, But Poor User Guide
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: Ok, the HDX 8.9 is a 5 star, great item.  This is my 6th Kindle.  (2 used by grown children, 1 to sr. citizen mother, 1 used by grandchild, and my Kindle HD 8.9 now goes to husband.) So I've grown with the Kindles, from Fire 7", Fire HD 7", Fire HD 8.9", and now the Fire HDX 8.9".  Each one has new improvements.  And up until the HDX 8.9 the user guide has been really good.  But with this Kindle, you can now use the Mayday feature and get instant help (I haven't used it, so don't rely on this info).  Apparently Amazon has decided that no one would prefer to just look it up for themselves.  So you can't.  The information isn't there. The user guide is a very shallow overview.  If you have never used a Kindle Fire, the guide will tell you how to charge, plug in to a computer, register or unregister your Kindle, purchase content, and other basics.  But you won't be able to find out how to do the new, nifty stuff.  For that, you need to contact Amazon or hit the Kindle Forum.  Which means you may not know what you're missing because there isn't anything in the user guide to tell you what your Kindle can do. I've already had to contact Amazon twice to find out how to do things I could do on the HD 8.9.  It's just different enough on the HDX that I needed info.  An adequate user guide would have been useful. Perhaps Amazon will make one available in the near future (I hope).Don't let this deter you from getting the HDX 8.9.  It's a great tablet. And Amazon has the BEST customer service I have ever used, so the answer to my questions were just a quick phone call away. I just wish I had the choice to use the user guide instead. This is especially true when I'm in the middle of nowhere, because wifi isn't always available. 4G isn't always available. Electricity and running water aren't available.  We're that kind of weekends and vacations people.The HDX 8.9 comes with a 9W AC adapter and cord to charge your Kindle.  These adapters are $20 if purchased separately, and charge Kindle Fire models, as well as phones and similar items, in half the time of standard adapters. The HDX 8.9 takes great pictures (haven't used the video function yet), and is so light, you actually feel the difference compared to the HD 8.9.  Because it's different from the HD, I'm still getting used to some differences in using features, but after a week, I haven't found anything missing from the HDX 8.9 that the HD 8.9 had, and there are lots of new goodies. It's a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Ipad hooey
Reviews.Author: WALter Sanders
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, awesome display great battery life this is a delight to use I was hesitant at first and thought maybe an Ipad would be the way to go for my tablet needs but so far no regrets and the money I saved can go to my next new toy!

Reviews.Title: Its my prized possession
Reviews.Author: JACKIE ESSEN
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is amazing very lightweight, bright screen that is so large it is mistaken for an ipad which I quickly correct and explain the many reasons why its better!!! Thank you so much I love this product!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display
Reviews.Author: bin zheng
Reviews.Content: Best tablet ! BEST DISPLAY ! And Fast! First time post review .Love it .Love Amazon.I think will buy one more .

Reviews.Title: Terrific Tablet
Reviews.Author: De'Angela Thompson
Reviews.Content: This tablet is slim and sleek and easy to use. Even though we already own iPads, this tablet was the top pick in our family. We ended up purchasing one.

Reviews.Title: prefer over my IPad
Reviews.Author: Mindywills "Mindy"
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love it! Crystal clear display, very quick! I will probably sell my IPad and I have been been an IPad & IPhone user for years! I do wish that it had flash, but alas it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME !!!
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Rich
Reviews.Content: iPad what ??? This is it...Welcome to the real world of Tablets Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 !!! No GPS ??? Big whop...Fast/great screen/colors galore/features iPad users dream of...And don't get me goin' on the Camera...BIG bang for your buck...Just great..Get one TODAY...

Reviews.Title: What a Difference a Few Inches Make!
Reviews.Author: Bob O.
Reviews.Content: Upgrading from my 7" Kindles (one keyboard, one Fire) to the 8.9" model is like working and living in a 900 sqft space and suddenly moving into a 26,000 sqft mansion.  The almost 3 inch difference in screen size doesn't seem like that much, but everything is bigger, brighter, and more detailed.  Yes, the price about doubles, but the benefits far outweigh that increase.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Newman
Reviews.Content: I didn't know if I would love this one or not. I got it and opened it and couldn't believe how much lighter this one was. I like the new design and the picture is wonderful on it. I feel in love with this and I glad that I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet, but didn't really live up to my expectations compared to last generation HD Fire.
Reviews.Author: Shawn B. Wikle "wik"
Reviews.Content: To tell the honest trust, so far I've only had this for about a week, but I'm not hugely impressed over my last generation HD Fire.  Yes, the picture quality is better, but on such a small screen, it's not all that noticeable. I have not noticed any speed improvement for normal tasks, even though I know this one has more powerful processors.  First time I've really been a little disappointed in a Kindle and this is my 5th one.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This is everything as advertised. Fast, light, intuitive and sharp. No steep learning curve. The cameras work great front and rear.

Reviews.Title: Loving My Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Nancy Kellum
Reviews.Content: I am loving my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.I had pre-ordered it and the wait was well worth it.This is my first tablet.It has been very easy for this grandmother to set up and use.I have been enjoying streaming videoes through Amazon Prime.The picture and sound quality are top notch.My Kindle Fire HDX has also added to my Christmas pleasure.I have downloaded and been playing my Christmas music on it and love the sound quality.I would highly recommend the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.I am also glad that I went for the larger screen.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  This is nice!
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Lence
Reviews.Content: After reading all the pros and cons of this product I'm glad I chose this one.  Because I was already an Amazon customer I didn't even have to go through all the registering process.  Very easy to set up e-mail and download games and apps.

Reviews.Title: Awkward
Reviews.Author: Gustav Ratzenhofer "Gus"
Reviews.Content: Difficult to navigate and very touchy.  Have decided to return it and go back to my abacus. Perhaps a person of need will acquire this used Kindle and find a use for it.

Reviews.Title: Not worth upgrading from Kindle Fire HD 8.9 to HDX
Reviews.Author: Diane Loll
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle fire HD for my son & the HDX for myself. I didn't think the graphics were all that wonderful and side by side the HD looked better. The HDX kept locking up everytime I tried to play a game or watch a movie. I called tech and tech was in the Philippines!  And, she just had me reset the HDX to factory settings.  I did that several times and it still licked up.  I sent it back and bought the Kindle HD and I love it!! Honestly. ..it's just not eorth the extra money.  Id but the Kindle fire HD again and again. And I did! I git one fir my mom and my oldest do as well. That's 4 Kindle Fire HD's to show how much I live it! My mom loves hers and my 13 year old son loves his too. A grest gift fir you and those you live♡

Reviews.Title: make sure you understand the limitations
Reviews.Author: Carl D. Willis-Ford
Reviews.Content: If you've never used another tablet (iPad, Nexus, etc.) before, you may really enjoy the Kindle Fire...the hardware is very good, the display is very nice, and you get Amazon goodness.However -If you're used to one of those other tablets, beware.  First of all, for a premium tablet, the Kindle Fire doesn't have GPS.  Secondly, you are SEVERELY limited in what you can do with this tablet.  Amazon really only wants you to use for reading their books and watching their movies.  They realized that they couldn't sell a tablet without games, so have a limited set of games available.  This is NOT an Android tablet.  Amazon took the Android operating system and seriously customized it, removing the ability to use any browser other than the one they wrote (at least one if not ore generations behind current Chrome, Firefox, or Opera), you can't use the Google Play Store, you have to use Amazon's store, which doesn't have near the variety of apps.All in all, it is disappointing that Amazon advertises this as an iPad competitor, when it is so ridiculously limited.**Update** based on a comment, I will be more accurate and say that you can't run a browser other than Silk without sideloading it...in other words, you cannot download another browser from the Amazon App Store, you have to change a setting to allow loading apps from unknown sources, then load the browser apk file from another website or device...something that many folks that aren't tech-savvy will not want to do.My assessment still stands as-is...great hw (except missing GPS) but overly restrictive, modified OS.**Update** after using it for several months now, I bumped it up to 4 stars because I find that I do very little with it outside of reading and watching videos of my granddaughter.  For that, it is performing admirably.  I don't ask it to do all the things I ask from my iPad, so I shouldn't rate it comparably (even though it is advertised as iPad competition).

Reviews.Title: Frozen Hell
Reviews.Author: Mookie
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle HDX for a month and it froze four times so far.  I have to let it power down since it won't shut off using the off button.  After recharging it, I used the Mayday button and they told me that it may have overheated and that I should do a hard reboot (hold the off button for twenty seconds).  It happened again but figured that it overheated again because the back of the Kindle WAS hot.  The third time, Mayday checked to see if I had the most recent update (I did) so I did the hard reboot and it worked fine.  I decided to do a hard reboot once a week and make sure that it doesn't overheat.  I did the reboot this morning, listened to music from my cloud and then put it down to do other stuff.  Several hours later, I picked it up to play a word search game and it FROZE AGAIN!!!  It had only been on for two minutes and the back was completely cool.  I'm done.

Reviews.Title: Warning: People who know Apple products -- The Kindle Fire is not an Apple iPad replacement.
Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Let me get through the good things about the tablet before I go into why I feel when comparing it to any Apple iPad, from generation 1 through the new iPad Air is a comparison not for those that understand what Apple is doing with the iPad and wants to enjoy an Apple product experience.Since I feel these two tablets cannot be compared, I will give a review of the Kindle Fire HDX's features as that is the only level one could possibly compare it to an Apple iPad Air.The Kindle has an unquestionably good resolution screen with a higher PPI than the iPad Air (I will trust both companies on their numbers. As when PPI gets above what Apple calls a retina screen, my peepers cannot tell the difference).  So don't worry about the screen, either tablet presents what is being displayed in a gloriously bright and clear manner.One item that I do wish Apple had included (In an aesthetically pleasant way, of course) is a microSD slot which would allow quick transfers of data without an additional dongle that plugs into the Lightning port.  The kindle provides this out of the box.The OS that is installed on the Kindle is what is irks me the most of all and is the reason I wouldn't suggest the purchase over an iPad Air.  The kindle has an obvious purpose here and it has become overtly advertised with the discounted kindles like the Fire HDX that ruins the feel that you are getting a premium product; "Special Offers!" Once you realize what Amazon's true goal of the Kindle Fire is; to try to sell you more products from Amazon based upon what you do with your tablet, or should I call it their tablet as you are losing your privacy from where you are when you do whatever it is that you do with that* kindle.This is a deal breaker to me as I know how iOS on the iPad Air was designed and who it was designed for; the business sector and Apple users that think like the designers.  The iOS operating system is very detailed about when it is going to provide personally identifiable information to an application regardless of developer (Apple or any other).  Apple also does not let out any applications that attempt to gain user information without absolute transparency and asking first.  This walled garden is something that cannot have a price attached to it.With the Kindle HDX, you are paying for a device that is letting a company know what you are doing with their tablet at all times. When you consider this factor in the pricing hype over the Kindle HDX you would not be alone to wonder what they are paying you to use their tablet over a protected Apple iPad Air. (I cannot stop thinking of this tablet like those free* internet providers that  were around a few years back as well as those companies that used to give you a free computer that used these same targeted advertising techniques Amazon has rediscovered and deployed with the Kindle HDX).I expect Amazon to keep information on what I search their site for and what I purchase from them.  But this is where I feel our relationship should stop.  If you are comfortable with this information keeping aspect of the Kindle Fire and the absence of a large, tested and safe marketplace of applications and add-ons from tripod mounts to microphones to lens attachments and more.  The Kindle Fire HDX might be good for you. Be sure to try one out first at a Best Buy where you can compare it to the iPad Air.I will continue to use my regular Paperwhite Kindle, to read eBooks.  This is one thing the Kindle Fire can't do, surprisingly.  But to get that paper-like look you need an eINK display not a high resolution one like the Kindle Fire HDX and the iPad Air have.For my peace of mind, I am going to return the one I purchased to the store and stomach the slightly higher price of the iPad Air.  At least now I know why I am paying for the product that I will feel is COMPLETELY mine.

Reviews.Title: Only good for kids.  Can't run apps from the Google Store.
Reviews.Author: R. Singer
Reviews.Content: Amazed to learn that Amazon prevents you from loading apps from the Google Store.  To my knowledge, Amazon's are the only Android devices that do that.  Instead, you can only load apps from Amazon.  There are dramatically less apps in Amazon's store than Googles.  All of the business and art apps that I use on my phone are not in the Amazon store.Other than that, this makes a great toy for a kid.  Toy because even the educational app selection is limited.I don't understand why more people aren't complaining about this.  I'm guessing they don't realize what they're missing.

Reviews.Title: OK if you want to live in a walled-in world
Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Ordered this HDX 8.9 for all you've probably read about it's graphics, processing speed, light-weight, cost, etc.The way it's setup and organizes things for you to find are done well enough.The battery held up OK for me. Not great but OK. I spent 3-4 hours exploring the HDX and playing about 15 minutes of video, placed it in sleep mode and let it sit for another couple of hours and the battery was nearly drained. I wouldn't consider that excellent but OK.The wireless connection on my HDX gave out several times. Uncertain as to why as my other wireless devices were working just fine from the same location and only a few feet from the wireless router. I've read other reviews where this was a problem. Perhaps a driver upgrade for the wireless would fix the issue at a later time.For the most part, my HDX lived up to the hype but at the end of the day, I just couldn't justify spending this money on an android device which won't play nice and allow downloading/installing Google apps.Amazon simply doesn't have enough apps to fit my needs and for this reason, I had to reluctantly return it.I've read about ways to circumvent this and get some Google apps installed but it's simply not worth the hassle for me.Seems Google, Apple and Amazon all want people feeding from their trough and their trough only. Can't we all just get along? :)If you primarily live and breathe in the world of Amazon and only need browsing capabilities outside the Amazon world, this might fit your needs. Otherwise, think twice about what apps you may want or need to use and check the Amazon app store.I'm waiting for the next version of the Google Nexus 10 to see what that offers.

Reviews.Title: Bad Kindle Fire HDX --- Amazon Customer Relations having bad day...
Reviews.Author: Hardware4you
Reviews.Content: Purchased two Kindle Fire HDX...the first in November 2013...perfect in every way.  The Second Kindle Fire HDX - 64. Purchased December 15th.  Miles apart from the first one.  The machine locked up X 3 and playing a game, got black screen and nothing worked...Help in start button when game finally reset.  The three times it reset, hard reset from Kindle Fire HDX.  This means reset to Factory Defaults and start over loading apps from the cloud and input of email addresses.  I also noticed that many game apps would try to play automatically without me touching screen.  Amazon does not have a fix for this. My wife's Kindle Fire HDX plays these same games without any problem. Called and emailed Amazon Customer Service, first time ever to be treated rudely.  Spoke with foreign lady with bad English.  The big man in red must have ruined her holiday with a few bags of coal.  Solution without Amazon's help...sending unit back for a refund as defective.  I would have settled for a replacement unit but customer care being nasty took care of that idea.  I now have ordered a Apple Air 128 GB.  Suppose to be here soon.  Amazon usually blows the competition away with helpful customer service.  I have emailed them that Amazon is the best company on earth.  Bad customer service lowers them to the rest of the competition.  Sorry the Kindle Fire HDX 64 did not work correctly.  This was our Kindle number 9 and our first troublemaker.

Reviews.Title: Nice machine, but not for Google users
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Although the specs for this tablet are amazing, it’s NOT for anyone who has themselves integrated with Google (i.e. Gmail, G-cal, G-drive, Hangouts, Google+, Chrome), and probably not the right choice for anyone who likes the way they currently use the internet or their smartphone.  It’s extremely limited unless you got it for reading and watching Amazon content.  You can’t easily use any of the Google things, not even the Chrome browser, so you have to start from scratch.  You can use their e-mail app and calendar to get to Gmail, but if you’re like me and you share calendars with other Gmail users, good luck figuring out how to see those on the Kindle.  I returned it and ordered the LG G Pad 8.3 Google Play Edition so it has straight Android Kit Kat, just like my Nexus 4 phone.  As soon as I logged into Google on the G Pad, it immediately downloaded all the apps that I have on my phone and everything’s ready to go.  I also downloaded the Kindle app and now I can read books just fine.  All my e-books are there waiting for me.  I’m not sure why Amazon made such a great tablet and then restricted it so severely.  It’s a shame, but just not worth the money without access to Google apps.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Sherion Beck
Reviews.Content: Best money I ever spent..  Perfect for what I use it for.  Research, emails.games.reading books. Even great for taking pictures. Lightweight.  Online quick tech support. Wondered if 16g would be enough for me but so far ..no problem.have had it for about 9 months now. Would not trade for any other on the market.

Reviews.Title: Nice screen
Reviews.Author: Glenn R Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: Nice large easy to read screen. Has a nice selection of apps, ebooks and emagazines. Well worth the upgrade. I really like  how you order and read magazines from Amazon. Great device.

Reviews.Title: adds
Reviews.Author: donald hubbard
Reviews.Content: Other than the constant adds, I am basically satisfied with the device. More choices for apps would be nice. It is my third Kindle device.

Reviews.Title: Does not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Vicki L. Duhr
Reviews.Content: Have spent many hours with Mayday people trying to work through things that should have worked right out of the box. I can't even buy things from Amazon without  having  to resort to tech support.I did not buy this device to spend hoursand hours and with tech support trying to get it to work. And don't expect much help from the Mayday support. I have been waiting  4 days so far for a supervisor to return my call on one issue and 26 days on another issue...Why these devices aren't beta tested before they send them out is a mystery.NO MAP application included...since Google maps and Mapquest need GPS to  work and the Kindle Fire does not have GPS( why it doesn't is another great  mystery).Many of the  applications in the App Store don't work on Kindle fire but you have to read the reviews to glean this knowledge.

Reviews.Title: The longer I own it, the more problems I find.
Reviews.Author: Lawrence of Sarasota "Lawrence of Sarasota"
Reviews.Content: When I first received my Kindle, I was thrilled.  They idea of the Mayday was impressive.  But, what I found is that the Kindle is not that intuitive.  Now, after 2 1/2 months, I still stumble around looking for a way to do something and have to resort to the Mayday.  That said, a number of times, the MAYDAY staff has needed to hand me off to KINDLE SPECIALIST who do not have the ability for remote access.  They have to talk you through the situation that the MAYDAY people couldn't handle.  The current problem came about when I was getting an error message on my email.  The Mayday people had to hand me off.  to the Kindle specialist.  Eventually, the error message went away but it seemed to have wiped out my contact list.  Again, the MAYDAY people couldn't handle it so, for the second time today, I was handed off to the KINDLE SPECIALIST.  He said to wait 2 - 4 hours and see if the contact list comes back.No two ways about it, the color is great!  The convenience of getting your email is good (not withstanding the problems listed above), its great for reading Kindle books, etc, etc. It just isn't the all out winner I expected.Then, there are the claims that led me to buy the Kindle such as its improved camera and screen.  It claims, "The HDX display features dynamic image contrast, a unique feature that automatically optimizes the color of each pixel based on the amount of light in your surroundings. This makes images and videos even easier to see in any lighting conditions, including outdoors."  The truth is, I have used the camera outdoors and cannot even see the icon you need to press to take a photo!!  Is it just my unit or all units?

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: John A. Lee
Reviews.Content: For the price, I thought I was buying a used Kindle Fire.  What I received was a KF that wasn't able to be registered with Amazon..thus many features were unable to be used.  I called Amazon customer service..they checked the serial number and said that it had been reported as lost or stolen, so they couldn't register it.  SO, I had to pay teh shipping back to the seller as well as a 10% restocking fee.  Won't use this seller ever again!

Reviews.Title: very frustrating
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Simmons
Reviews.Content: If you need a highly functional tablet you may be disappointed. Can't even find a simple bookshelf app that you don't have to go through a thousand steps to use. Sad.

Reviews.Title: In Love
Reviews.Author: ChaosMom
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would own a tablet. I have issues with the way first world countries abuse conflict minerals. After doing a great bit of research I decided to buy the Kindle Fire with 32 GB. It's very easy to use. It is light weight and comfortable to hold, although I do plan on buying the origami folding case to go with it and the screen protector. I feel that I received a very good bargain for the money spent and would recommend the Kindle table to anyone. I do want to note that some people find Android tablets a better platform to work from but the Kindle is a good tablet for a beginner. I have already used the *mayday* button and was answered quickly by a young man named Anthony who was eager to help and more importantly, to teach! All in all I am thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Good Price
Reviews.Author: J. Lukomski
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is a great tablet at a good price.  The sharpness of the display is fantastic and I'm glad that I purchased the larger display.  In the several months I've used it  the tablet has performed flawlessly.  I actually would rate it as a 4.5 instead of just four.  The limitation is that it doesn't support Flash and the number of apps available is still relatively smaller than available to other brands.  Haven't needed to use Help yet but its good to know the service is there.

Reviews.Title: Cautiously optimistic now that I side loaded Google Chrome
Reviews.Author: LLF1020
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Kindle Fire until I received the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  The Silk browser shuts down and even after Amazon sent me a refurbished unit (Amazon will only give you a refurbished unit even if you only had your unit for two months) I am still experiencing the same problem and have researched and this topic and I am not the only one. I am so disappointed in the Silk Browser. I side loaded Google Chrome last night and cross fingers so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Cherie H McKelvey
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet. I own an iPad, an iPad mini,Fire he and the new8.9 hex. Hdx is the best I have owned. Wi-Fi reception is far superior to any iPad product. Processor is fast and stable. Apple's app store has more but Amazon has everything I'll ever need. Screen is superior as well. Unless you are Apple groupie, this is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: I love this one!
Reviews.Author: TamScamp
Reviews.Content: Bought this bigger Kindle for family use, and the ability to pre-record free movies tipped the scales to 'buy', as I have a mother and sister who both can require medical tests and such, requiring the driver to kill hours of time in a waiting room.  Being able to engage in a two hour movie fits that bill perfectly.  The movies are truly amazingly crisp and the sound quality is grand.  An unexpected bonus is the much larger playing field and larger playing 'pieces' with games.  Amazon continues to amaze me with the things the Kindles can do, and I haven't really sat down and tried out all the bells and whistles yet!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M. Sacks
Reviews.Content: great screen, battery life, very nice; able to use in many ways. priced right and great amazon service as always

Reviews.Title: One of the best in the class
Reviews.Author: Sarat
Reviews.Content: One of the best tablets in the market. This is very much comparable to Apple's iPad. I wish there was a way to expand storage on this device like Samsung provides.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: janice simpson
Reviews.Content: I have only had my kindle for a few days. This is my first tablet. So far I love it.

Reviews.Title: I'm Glad I Did It
Reviews.Author: MAD
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a bit of time reading reviews and mulling over whether or not to buy the Kindle Fire HDX.  I'm glad I did.  It's terrific.  It allows me to do so much:  read, play word games, browse the Internet, shop, stream video, etc.  How could you not like it?  There are some quirks (e.g., the touch screen is supersensitive, so I prefer to use a stylus), but you can adjust to them easily enough.  I really needed a device that would allow me to be productive away from home, and so far the Kindle fits the bill.  I am still working my way through some of the features, but to date I am very pleased with my purchase.  Go for the 8.9" for greater ease of use.  And, the Mayday function, which I've needed to use only once--to get both purchasing and technical setup information--is invaluable.

Reviews.Title: Amazon built in software to force you to buy overpriced Oragami
Reviews.Author: V. L.
Reviews.Content: While many things are decent with this device, Amazon built in a "feature" that doesn't let you take pictures with third party cases on it. It's a software thing they did intentionally to force people to buy their ridiculously over priced Oragami case, which is heavy and gets poor reviews. This is really poor behavior from Amazon. The forums are.lit up with people complaining. Amazon could fix it easily, but that would cost profit on the Oragami.

Reviews.Title: Overall, disappointing
Reviews.Author: Joe Brockmeier
Reviews.Content: The killer feature for this tablet, for me, is being able to download Amazon Prime content for later use. I travel quite a bit, and wanted to be able to watch movies/shows available via Prime when I am on the road. Unfortunately, there are several "gotchas" with this feature that make the Kindle quite a disappointment.1) You might think that *all* Amazon Prime shows / movies would be available for download. You'd be wrong. It seems most TV shows are available, but movies? I'd say maybe 1 out of 4 movies I looked at are available for download.2) Even when you download content, Amazon wants to "phone home" frequently due to DRM. I took the tablet on a two-week trip to Europe where I had infrequent access to Wi-Fi and wanted to watch shows on flights. Several movies refused to play at all unless I connected to Wi-Fi to "correct a problem" that demanded Internet access. This was a rude surprise, and I was deeply disappointed that having spent quite a bit of time loading the Kindle with content turned out to be a waste of time.Since the Kindle Fire is based on Android, you might expect to have some of Android's more popular apps - like Chrome, YouTube, or Google Maps. Nope. None of these are easily available on the Kindle Fire.I will give the Fire high marks as a playback device. If you download content in its highest resolution, it looks and sounds fantastic. The X-Ray feature is also pretty nifty, if you're connected to a network when watching shows on Amazon Streaming. Unfortunately, I didn't really buy it for home streaming - I have a TV to watch content on when I'm home.Bottom line: I'm really sorry that I bought it. I hope Amazon will open up the download feature to other tablets before too long, as I'd prefer to have a tablet that does everything I want - and the Fire isn't it.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: old sarge
Reviews.Content: I love the HDX,  the display  is as good or better than than my wife's IPad, the kindle is as fast as the IPad as well.the colors on the HDX are fabulous , it is lighter than the IPad also. I have had no trouble with the HDX.

Reviews.Title: HDX is OK, but...
Reviews.Author: N. Wolter "photog gal"
Reviews.Content: I received this Kindle today and began a comparison between it and my HD.I saw no discernible resolution difference between them.I did not care for the reduced size of Carousel items. Also, the power on 'button'? placement was odd-- easily powered off when holding the HDX.I'm very happy with my HD--I like the solid feel of it.I am returning the HDX.

Reviews.Title: Bluetooth problem and fix
Reviews.Author: Farron D. Brougher
Reviews.Content: My comments will not duplicate the many through reviews already posted and are specific to a Bluetooth pairing problem that turned out to be easy to solve. My Phiaton PS 210 BTNC earbuds paired to two earlier generation Kindles on the first try, but not only wouldn't pair with the HDX but weren't even recognized. The solution: read the manual.I actually read and followed the simple steps provided by Phiaton--for the first time--and pairing worked on the first try. I should add that Amazon Mayday and a referral to a "Kindle generalist" were helpful and patient, superb customer service.

Reviews.Title: need some help on how to connect to my ATT moble wi fi
Reviews.Author: jerry R
Reviews.Content: I am a 74 year old gentleman without very much training on how to use a tablet and i am having much trouble getting information on how to use my kindle fire WI -FI . please EMAIL me with some help thank you.

Reviews.Title: Very good but missing the mark-too bad..I wanted to like this unit!
Reviews.Author: J. Lerner "Ny Ranger fan"
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I an Amazon Prime member. I love the whole ecosystem. I bought this because I loved the idea of being able to download the Prime videos. I find that Amazon limits only a very select number of movies to download. To me, thats a major mistake. This unit has the best picture for watching movies. Its actually incredible. However, since this unit only uses a limited version of Android your missing allot of apps.Its a fast unit not any faster than the iPad air.The sound coming out of this unit is the best!As a reader its excellent-unlike the smaller version there is no blue haze while reading your books.In short an excellent unit but misses the mark-If you want a more well rounded unit go iPad air or Nexus units if Android is your preferred system.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Beth R.
Reviews.Content: I really like my kindle hdx. I am disappointed because I thought it was hdmi compatible. I do like the x ray feature and the mayday.

Reviews.Title: Wow..just wow
Reviews.Author: Prime Risk "primerisk"
Reviews.Content: We took the leap and went for the 8.9" HDX this year after having 3 original Fires in the family for the last two years.  I also have a slew of other comparable devices including the Nexus 7 and iPad.  The HDX is just incredible.  The screen is gorgeous, very fast, and is so light it is believable.  My cousin's daughter got an iPad mini for Christmas and was absolutely drooling over our HDX.  She is a complete iHead and has said "nothing is better than Apple".  Well, she's rethinking those statements now.I'd like to comment on the Mayday functionality, but we had no reason to use it.  Everything worked perfectly as soon as we took it out of the box.  As soon as we put it on the wifi network it knew what account it was associated with and all of our books, music, and apps were all there where we expected them.  (We did have to specifically download applications we wanted, but they were all there associated with our account).  Just perfectly simple.My one problem though, we have 3 original Fires and only one HDX 8.9.  I see more HDXs in our future.  That's ok, I also got a Sonos system for Christmas and it will make it easy to leave the original Fires laying around as Sonos controllers!

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Juanita Harris
Reviews.Content: The screens so big,I didn't think it would be this much larger than my Fire,but it's really sooo much bigger.We spend a lot of time traveling so I bought this so I could download movies to watch.I've only done one and it played  fantastic.I read a reveiw by a guy that had all the data on this and several others so scroll till you find it,it's very imformative.I'm not an expert,just love to read,facebook,ect while watching football or on the road,and I've found a new companion!

Reviews.Title: loved at 1st
Reviews.Author: BRENDA BENNETT
Reviews.Content: very sorry to say this but I wanted something like the ipad and I found this and just knew that this was it.  everything compared to the apple ipad, and the price for the kindle was less.  could not wait to get it, we all liked it.  but know every time we tried a game it would lock up and nothing we did got it to work again.  we had to set it aside until the next day then it would work for some time then quit again.  sorry to of sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Eh.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Alden Greer
Reviews.Content: Well I have had this device for about 7 days and it's so capable. But the capabilities are lacking. Heavily. The app store is terrible. And I'd be fine with this if it was a cheap device. But for $394 I can get a Microsoft surface which will run everything I need. I may send this back for a refund. I love the book reading capability. Which is what I first requested it for. But you can apparently download an app that does the same thing on a surface. The case is hard to find I don't have the patience to chase one down. I dunno it's a cool device. But buy something else if you need a functional everyday tablet.

Reviews.Title: Total Upgrade:)
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This is a total upgrade from my kindle fire hd! I love that there is a rear view camera and that it has flash. The camera also has very good quality. I totally recommend this kindle :D !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: HD-Xcellence!
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Hopper
Reviews.Content: I had the original Kindle and then the Kindle Fire and now the HDX.  I have loved all my Amazon products.  The picture and image quality on the HDX is far superior to other devices.  And the integration to all my Amazon products and features is great.Finding new things everyday like the lyrics feature with my music.Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Brian Meiers
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 with high expectations.  Having seen and used friends Kindles, I was looking forward to seeing what the HDX had to offer.  I was NOT disappointed.  It has been easy to use, has beautifully clear images and the sound quality is AMAZING.  My family loves this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Daughters gift
Reviews.Author: SJM
Reviews.Content: This serves 2 purposes it gives my daughter a camera and a tablet.  She loves it and is constantly on it.  The set up was very easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: one of the best
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great! It definitely rivals an iPad and has amazing battery life. It looks really good and all around it's definitely with it's price.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Smooth "Smooth"
Reviews.Content: I have the old Kindle reader so since i want to go online and play games an such i decided on the new Kindle HDX. It was a toss up between the Kindle and the Samsung note. The reason being is because i needed my tablet to have a rear camera with a flash....The Kindle won..and I am very very happy with my decision. I even used the "mayday" which is in person help right from the kindle...

Reviews.Title: Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Brizi
Reviews.Content: I wasn't so sure about this at first...then I came across a store demo.  So far so food.  I had a negative visual of what a kindle fire would be like. I pictured the original grandma version.  But I'm quite impressed and surprised.  I was able to view other demos like Samsung and the IPad and it compared quite well.  The Kindle Fire HDX is attractive and efficient.  I Gove it a 4 because even though I bought it, I rather own the Samsung or the IPad and I had no idea that the Kindle FreeTime was a paid subscription although you have a 30 free trial period.  Other brands have similar feature for free.  I bought this for my son because that's what he wanted for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: MY NEW KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I own all the the kindle fire's everyone of them that has came out. The Kindle HDX is far my favorite. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: Got it within 12 hours!
Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: I ordered Kindle Fire XHD 8.9” at about 11PM on Dec 23, the system indicated the item will arrive on Thursday, Dec 26. That’s fine because I ordered it for myself. I didn’t ask for express delivery but Amazon did it. I received 2 packages from Amazon at 11AM on Dec 24, just an hour before my office closed for the holiday. One I knew what it was and the other I didn’t because I didn’t expect to receive the Kindle Fire XHD 8.9” until Dec 26. I opened the package thinking my daughter probable ordered a book from my “Wish List” for me and have it delivered to my office just in time. I was very surprised, amazed and pleased to find the package contained Kindle Fire XHD 8.9”. How did Amazon deliver it within 12 hours! And like many other reviewers I own a few version of kindle; the first generation of Kindle, the Kindle Keyboard, the first generation of Kindle Fire (still functioning perfectly). But reading a lot of reviews, seeing the ads and being a royal customer of Kindle family I have to try the Kindle Fire XHD 8.9”. I can’t give a review about the product yet because it is still in the box but I am impressed with how Amazon can get it to me within 12 hours. My Christmas wish is fulfilled. Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: A Surprise Gift
Reviews.Author: Agnes Murphy
Reviews.Content: It will take me a while to get to know my way around on this new instrument but I am enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Brilliance within the Amazon market ecosystem
Reviews.Author: R. Lurer
Reviews.Content: No third party apps like ALL my Realtor apps can't be used, can't put Chrome on am Android based tablet meaning no chromecast, otherwise utterly brilliant.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Allen G. Slocumb
Reviews.Content: I gave my Kindle Touch to a friend of ours and bought this unit. Book reading is great, lots and lots of aps. Couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Display
Reviews.Author: cincydon
Reviews.Content: I am giving this to my wife for Christmas. After setting it up befor wrapping it along with the matching case I was blown away. This is her third upgrade and by far the best yet. I will update after Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Not just the affordable tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: Even Amazon's own commercials portray it as the cheap alternative to the iPad, but I think they do their product a disservice selling that way. It's a great device. Easy to learn, easy to use & a pretty good selection of free apps. I had some crashing issues with a few, but nothing I haven't seen with most smartphones as well. Working with Amazon Prime Video is also a huge benefit. So if you're shopping for tablets, don't look at this as a "you get what you pay for" price shopping deal, look at it as a a true rival to the iPad that happens to be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but the software needs some work still.
Reviews.Author: J. Savage
Reviews.Content: Pro: HardwareIt's a good buy for the price. It also has USB which the iPad is known to lack to make life easier.Cons: the SoftwareLimited file types supported and you have to basically trick it to installing a different web browser just to install the missing Flash compatibility that the Silk browser lacks. It can separate your imported files (pictures video etc) into their own folders, but it isn't up front about it so you have to go through a couple menus to get the folders instead of just tapping the Photos section.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Juli
Reviews.Content: I really like the bigger screen and lower price.  I debated buying the iPad air but I am very happy I went with the Kindle Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Great kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Cate
Reviews.Content: I have tried all of the new kindle fires: new kindle fire hd, kindle fire 7" hdx, and the kindle fire hdx 8.9.  All three of the new kindle fire family are amazing tablets. I picked to keep the kindle hdx 8.9 because it meets more of my needs. Reason one I do online classes so I need large screen to view courses and to view word documents. Reason two I both like reading and watching videos which it is great for both.Theses are reason why I chose the kindle fire hdx 8.9 but all of other kindle fire are wonderful too. But the kindle fire hdx 8.9 is the perfect tablet for me.

Reviews.Title: She Loves It
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My wife is on her Kindle all the time. The HDX was a birthday/anniversary present and she has been like a little kid waiting for it to arrive.

Reviews.Title: Best Fire Yet
Reviews.Author: Book Lover "Linda"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the originalFire and really have enjoyed using it.  The new HDX is a wonderful tablet and exceeds my expectations.  The camera is great, the videos and movies watched on the Fire have excellent clarity, and the aps available are also good.  I can't say enough about this new Fire and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a step above tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best value
Reviews.Author: Arun Dongre
Reviews.Content: After comparing with other tablets chose this for good value. More bang for bucks. Clean looks and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Definite plus upgrade
Reviews.Author: Elda B. Hueth "Erae"
